WAt6PCic6J2lpkAw-beezQ.text: Let me start by saying that I was very torn on whether to give this restaurant a 3-star or 4-star review. Honestly, I would have given Tapas Papa Frita a 4-star review if I had never been to Spain and didn't have high expectations for paella. From the moment we walked in, the service was wonderful. Everyone from the seating hostess to our waiter was very attentive to our needs and wanting to make sure we had the best dining experience. Next, there were musicians outside playing all evening and they were great! The music really added to the ambiance.   We ordered a chef's special consisting of 6 selected tapas and the Paella Valenciana to share. This is where the downfall came for me. The tapas were good, but the paella needed improvement. Paella is a signature Spanish dish and if a restaurant really wants to sell me on its Spanish cuisine, the paella needs to be cooked and flavored correctly. When paella is cooked properly, a thick, crusty layer of rice (known as "soccrat") is formed at the bottom of the pan. This paella was almost soupy toward the bottom. Also, the paella missed the mark on the saffron flavoring and was instead rather salty. All that being said, the paella did have an abundant amount of shrimp, clams, and mussels!   Great service, atmosphere, entertainment, and tapas, but mediocre paella.

Z6GDEyrv7qU68u7y8dFxtA.text: This place is in a great location. Beautifully lit surroundings, right by the waterfront and bridge, perfect place to take a stroll in the evening. Restaurant has pretty patio overlooking river. This is why we decided to try it out for our first night out dinning experience in Scottsdale.  I had plenty of tapas in my life, what can go wrong right? We ordered Championes Al Jerez, Patatas Bravas and Pan Boli. The food was awful. I'm sorry to say this but this was the worst food that we ever had. The menu describe Championes Al Jerez as braised mushrooms with garlic and sherry. The mushrooms were blend and dipped in heavy olive oil (or some sort of an oil), no sherry taste whatsoever. Patatas Bravas are reheated soggy potatoe wedges , spicy, however over salted. The worst was Pan Boli. We were not really sure what it was when we got it. I mean I read the description on the menu but it just didn't seem right. The tomato paste was the worst. It looked like very pale pink mush, again heavily over salted, served with a sour cabbage in the middle of the plate as a garnishing? After we left the place, we were trying to recall if we ever had such a poor tasting meal through our travels and honestly we came to conclusion we haven't. So, in summary, getting glass of wine on the patio, sure but eating there no thanks.

m9MGDpDkNASI-G-BBZ_9Zw.text: Food was a little hit or miss. Some was quite good, other dishes we didn't love. Portion sizes varied sign. Atmosphere and service were pleasant, and we enjoyed the live music and dancer.

CIg_tzNaqHrxCp_AGHLjhw.text: Absolutely love this place. From the Tapas, sangria and what can I say about the Paella Valenciana all delicious. What a great place to come and unwind and enjoy delicious dishes.

qRDac2Gg_mttStJn4DWuPg.text: The atmosphere at this place is awesome. The waiter (Kevin)  we had at our outside cozy table was very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu.  The reason for the four stars. Food was good but doesn't warrant $$$ the price. It's paella for goodness sake. I understand the the spices a shaffron are expensive but a little pricy. Food was so, so..  Great date spot; atmosphere is awesome and wait staff was very attentive. I will go back but would be more selective of the menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

HwTr7brR2aIVZN8gjxd4Kw.text: Food was adequate. Somewhat bland. And I ended up with part of a mussel Shell in my rice. It's also a struggle with a rice based dish when none of the shrimp tails are removed. I essentially paid $20 for rice.   Service was slow. And the kitchen didn't seem to know how to do multiple tickets for the same table and our meals came out disjointed. As did the desserts. I asked for iced tea and was given sweet tea. Not a huge deal, but I discovered that the server probably didn't even know because they only make so much iced tea for the evening and when the regular is out, they just give sweet tea to the customer.   Coffee was outstanding. Atmosphere was loud. It was really hard to hear other people at the table. That was even before music and the flamenco dancer (which was very entertaining).  It then took a long time to get the checks, longer to have them picked up. And one food runner knocked my chair every time he passed and didn't acknowledge he had done so.   The place was packed so other people may have had better experiences than I did.

2h_cVuge1NauTxV0_TqehQ.text: I loved the crab stuffed pepper, the goat cheese stuffed medjool date wrapped in bacon was a wonderful surprise (that I cannot duplicate at home no matter how hard I try), the sauteed shrimp was to die for... What are you waiting for?  Get a table!

t1UNPDkbiBvuV7gp5CGv6g.text: I was initially hesitant to stop by due to the mediocre reviews, but my husband and I traveled from Orange County for the weekend and are so glad we came by. This place amazed us with the complex and anything but bland flavors of each of the 7 dishes we ordered. From the seafood soup, the lamb chops, stuffed dates, oxtail, and even the creme brulee, we couldn't decide which we loved more. They even started us off with a complimentary bread basket with a delicious garlic aioli. The ambiance on the patio was delightful with authentic and tasteful live Spanish music. Arturo, our waiter, was with great spirits, customer service, and when I asked which vegetable dish he recommended, he immediately said 'I got it', and surprised us with a delightful choice of leek and cheese pockets with a great sauce. Arturo was the cherry on top to our splendid experience at Tapas Papa Frita. Highly recommend this restaurant ! Location is also perfectly walkable to all of downtown shops.

W0VfucPZNy-i7jMfePvolA.text: My friends decided to choose Tapas Papa Frita to celebrate my birthday, and what a great experience this was! It was a slower evening, hence service wasn't as prompt as it could've been. They had live Flamenco dancing on throughout the night from the time we entered around 7:30 PM till the we left around 10:00 PM. The food you ask? Amazing! I didn't find a single item that I didn't like, and we did order quite a few of them. The Paella was great and served in the authentic Spanish way (had enough Paella in Spain to know this), and the tapas were filling enough for me to not even get to an entree' for the night. And then the birthday dance, making this evening one memorable one. Price is not the cheapest, but totally worth it for the experience you get. Totally recommended!

zrIzo-61yPy6-vd8idoSBQ.text: Eating at this restaurant was the worst experience I have ever had. My boyfriend and I just got back from a trip to Spain, and we were ecstatic to be able to eat tapas again!  We went during restaurant week with a pre-decided 3 course meal. The first two courses arrived reasonably on time, but the desert took forty minutes. For fried plantains. Around us, individuals who sat down after us were leaving. And someone ordered a steak after our desert, and it was out before. After my boyfriend talked to management, our deserts came out but we still did not receive the desert wine we should have. And no bill. He had to get up and find the server to request it.  We were there two hours and saw our server maybe 3 times. And the food? Not worth the hassle. Unfortunately, it was very bland. No redeeming factors. I would not recommend.

7V_0qQnlTldKhhOxl97gIA.text: II had high hopes for this place "Authentic Spanish Tapas and Cuisine are the highlight".   I will give them 2 stars for having good tapas although extremely pricey.  Beware that if they offer you 6 tapas for two for $25 they mean $25 per person.  Paella at this establishment is anything but authentic.  Their paella is made with long grain rice, not Arroz Bomba de Calasparra or Arroz Bomba de Valencia or any other variant - but long grain rice!  Why advertise yourself as authentic?  Paella is all about the rice and cooking technique.

0i21E68qO1pcwYBDaJWm2Q.text: 1st time I came here the experience was better maybe because it was my birthday.  2nd time, the service was horrible!!! Our waitress was not attentive to me and my friend. She was nice at first and helped with our drink and food orders after that it went down hill. She never once handed us our food. Think the buss boys helped us more than she ever did. The buss boys gave us our drinks and food. Every time we would ask for our waitress she would show up 5-7 or maybe 10 mins later and ask us what else did we need. Our waitress never checked up on us every so often. We had to consistently ask for our waitress and thats when her light bulb went off and finally became more attentive to us. It was a horrible service experience that night, but everyone else around was getting excellent service from the other waitresses and waiters. we left her a total of 4 dollar tip on almost a 100 dollar bill, cause her service was not up to par. And the food, nothing on the menu had anything that had a even a little spice to it. Its a Spanish restaurant but none of the items on the menu had anything spicy.  Waitress name is Raquel

j3suOEsAVPtIAH3KG-0m6A.text: Came on recommendation and it was awesome. Beautiful outdoor seating,  comfortable, excellent service,  beautiful lighting.  Food reminded me of trip to Spain,  lovely presentation,  melt in your mouth. ..had chefs special, lamb chops, dates stuffed and wrapped in bacon,  stuffed peppers,  'Manchego cheese,  beef tips in sauce, paella. Paella had mussels,  clams,  shrimp,  meat,  veggies. Amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Stuffed dates and Manchego cheese tapas
Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Seafood paella

jnCQEqmwANpX4NbOM_oCmQ.text: My new favorite restaurant. Jorge, the bartender, is superb and our server Aaron was fantastic! The food was AMAZING! Everything we ordered was delicious. Bacon wrapped date had me speechless. Might have to fly to Scottsdale just for the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. We cherished every bite! So delicious!
Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Beautiful atmosphere
Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Everything was so delicious!!!

dLgyHaplxr0TBPYK310iww.text: Let me start with LIVE FLAMENCO!   This place is amazing! From the Sangria to the Albondigas to the Churros! This place is AMAZING! First time here, first time visiting Scottsdale, happened upon this place. Service is EXCELLENT and food is great! Came here on a Friday night and was delighted with live flamenco! Must try the shrimp in garlic sauce and calamari also! Worth the five star rating!

WAMahWz1K1GTHibQgOy-JQ.text: Recently check out this for my first time with a group of about 10+ for a friends birthday.  Overall the location decor and environment were great, unique in the area and right along the canal in oldtown.  Great Patio and live music made for a wonderful environment.  Food overall was fantastic and the prices where not extreme.  I am right on the cusp of 3 and 4 stars but as they were easily fixable small issues I gave the restaurant the benefit of the doubt.  My  complaints where service related, there was nothing major but there were several things that that are small but would have made my experience 5 stars if properly exicuted.    First off I have only been to a Tapas restaurant a few times and for those who don't know you get allot of small plates instead of 1 big meal.  Its fun when properly executed.   The first issue was apparent right away 10+ people lots of small plates, we had asked when reservation was made about separate checks they said no problem.  When brought up during ordering you would think that we asked for the waiters first born daughter.  Its the 21st century if you cant assign seat numbers and teach you staff how to set it up in your POS system there are issues.  Either way be consistent with what you say, anyway ill wrap back to this.  Everyone started ordering small plates and big plates (full meals).  Food started coming out and no one knew where it went because everyone ordered a bunch of stuff and when you look at the menu you will understand why no one remembered exactly what they ordered.  Already back at seat numbers, help you staff and your clients its easy go to a chili's they can teach you how to do it.  Next issue there was 1 server for the whole section of the patio, other tables where clearly upset and we as the big table still did not get service because they where spending so much time with the other 6 tables in there section.  You lost out on at least 2-3 rounds of drinks by not having a second server backing you up or helping in the section.  I am sure some other reviews around this time will reflect the small table perspective of this as they looked pissed.    Everything was going well have been there for over an hour at this point rounds of tapas coming out everyone at the table has eaten and we are getting ready to get the tab.  Except the 3 people who got meals, still did not have their food.  At this point I was very hungry having watched the whole table eat these great little plates people even ordered seconds that came out way before my meal.  If there is going to be a 45 min difference in delivery you should warn clients, clearly the kitchen is not set up to handle both.  Ill leave it at that, simple sentence and would not have been an issue.  Lastly we finally ate now it was actually time for the bill, well just like i said it was a nightmare.  Brought a long bill that took forever to break down manually, then once we did it took them 25 min to process it.  All and all it actually was not a great experience and rethinking it right now I am going to have to change it to 3 star because they said they could split on the phone then refused to leading to allot of the bad experience.  Although with a couple or with one person picking up the check this would not be an issue but i would avoid it if you have more then 1 person paying.  I will be going back though it was a great atmosphere and food, will update this when I do....

u-zqCN_IXfypJIUzIVUuzw.text: Great restaurant and great atmosphere. I had an awesome great time with friends. I loved the tapas and the excellent paella. I can't wait to come back soon.

YmKHEJFwkmVlAApzGeiqRA.text: We called the Restaurant and asked for directions and told them we were on our way so when we showed up they said they were closed. Instead of sending us on our way they invited us in it was a full hour before they opened. The food was great I highly recommend it! Nice people great atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

lu3BawsPuyCN2f_WiNeqJA.text: I love this place! I dined here last Saturday with my Boyfriend.  I always read Yelp to see what's good to eat at places and some of the reviews were bad in terms of service for this place.  I experienced the best service.  The hostess was friendly and we were running late for our reservation.  Our table was towards the back but had a perfect view for the live music and flamenco dancer. I unlike some reviews found the music and volume of music to be great.  It was like having a gourmet dinner at a concert.   Our waiter Vincent was amazing!  He recommended the red sangria and the taste of Spain special for dinner.  The sangria was delicious and Vincent never let my cup stay empty.  The tour of Spain was really cool. My favorite small plate was the date wrapped in bacon. The paella was we ate which I think was the valencia or something.  It was very flavorful and I plan to go back and have it soon.  The atmosphere, service and food are worth the dining price. If you're looking to catch up and chat with someone the music could be distracting...I would go here to be entertained and have your taste buds amazed.

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The paella so yummy!

YciGAmyGInaKnNBpBeB76w.text: I think I have a new favorite restaurant in the Valley.  Our party of 5 started off with tapas.  I'll try to remember them all: manchego cheese with jamon, pan-fried bacala (cod), garlic sauteed shrimp, mussels in a spicy tomato sauce, and my two favorite: the lamb shanks and a special, which I was sad to learn isn't a mainstay: goat cheese-stuffed dates wrapped in bacon.  All were excellent.  The wrapped dates may be the single most unique thing I've ever eaten, and they were absolutely delicious.  The lamb, even though it "looked" overcooked, was fantastic.  Full of flavor, perfectly crusted, and very juicy.  For my entree I got the Valencian paella.  Absolutely delicious.  The Chistorra made the dish, as it added a perfect smoky flavor.    My fiancee got the chicken paella, which was very similar to mine, just lacking the shellfish.  The flavor was "simpler," but just as good in a different way.  I will be back, and frequently.  If two people were to stick to a few tapas and then split an order of paella, you could get out of here for relatively cheap and still have a full meal.  Excellent, attentive service, and a great outdoor patio right on the canal.

vyNTAASIscNfzml6ArvZpw.text: ok....I will try to make it quick and understandable: my wife and I like the place, that was our first visit. ok greeting (not really "professional")....great table, good food (tapas and paella). Here is where I have a problem: we both went with the suggested "Chef's special" (not certain that is what they call it) where for $45 each we get a selection of several tapas (Chef's choice), each get a paella and at the end a shot of some Spanish liquor that my wife really enjoyed....back to the "problem": the pleasant waiter asked which paella we wanted...the "regular" one or the one with lobster? Not aware that there were 2 paellas offered and at the strong recommendation of the waiter, we opted for one of each...both were very well prepared but lacking saffron all together...too bad! When the check came I was expecting the following: 45 + 45 + 60 (wine) = $ 150- (plus tax and gratuity of course) but instead it read: 45 + 25 + 35 = $165........when confronted with what seemed like an error, the waiter went into explanations we could not comprehend and assured us that he saved us a few $$...how so? If the lobster paella (tiny lobster tail) had an extra charge, he should have told us at the beginning. And $15 additional for a tiny frozen lobster tail is not right either. This being said, we will return but we will be more inquisitive. ...I forgot to say: the selection of tapas brought to us was plentiful and well prepared.

sXgEgNXv4h-n3okxn1c8iA.text: First time to Spanish Food N my first reaction WOW . Awesome food with awesome atmosphere. Loved Lamb chops, Artichoke hearts in Tapas N Paella was awesome. In desert I would recommend Flan or Brulee. Overall awesome is the WORD.

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cream Brûlée with Strawberry
Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Paellas
Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Artichoke Hearts

rXbdnNwwpu0cI_QHgx93mg.text: I love the vibe at this place.... Outdoor seating is the best, live music and flamenco dancing on weekends.... My fav are the Albondigas & the Crab Stuffed Peppers... Very friendly staff as well.

MCT0j7KdX7pTm5DEr5kCMg.text: After a day of drinking in Scottsdale, a group of my friends and I met here for dinner.  I had never had tapas before, so I wasn't entirely sure what to expect.  There are a LOT of options!  We arrived during happy hour, and the cheapest drink on the menu was a coke/red wine combo.  It sounded nasty, but I was so curious about it that I decided to order it anyway.  It was... not gross?  I'd never have thought to mix those two things together, but roll with it.  It's unique.  Our server was incredibly helpful in explaining all the dishes to us.  We ordered an array of tapas to share, and they were all quite good.  My favorite was definitely the Txipirones con Almendras, aka stuffed squid.  I used to think I was allergic to squid, but I decided to throw caution to the wind and try it anyway, and I'm glad I went for it.  Absolutely delicious, and squid ink is surprisingly tasty!  I can't recall everything we ordered (there were lots of plates going around!) but it was a good meal.  This is a fun restaurant to visit with a big-ish group of people so you can order tons of things and try them all.

6or6CzisG6mgNtwaNi4j1Q.text: Mmmmn...paellas!  We were seated al fresco under the messy palo verde tree.  Not too bad, just had to make sure the flowers didn't become part of our meal.  Sangria time...to go with that, the Calamari Soda Batter and Crab Stuffed red pepper was perfect.  My hubby and little cutie pie loved the bread and dip as well.  I had to have one with my Garlic egg drop soup.  It was reminiscent of French onion, but garlicky.  We shared the  Paella Arroz Negre (squid ink and seafood) which we were too full to finish.   We had zombie mouths while we were eating.  Brains!!!  Little cutie pie thought it was way cool!    Too bad we didn't have enough room for desserts, a good excuse to head back over...

DxoqloZPJOSZcFrwAxiHOw.text: So happy to have found this restaurant, it was the complete package for night out.   First, the decor welcomes you in and sets the mood...  Beautiful lighting, check Miro artwork, check Beautiful bar area and classy place settings, checkity check.  Next up, the food and drink. I ordered the Paella de Pollo and a number of Tapas. Everything was delicious and came out hot and fresh from kitchen. No overwhelming spices and heat in these dishes--the flavors are more subtle and carefully prepared. Pre-dinner rolls were not the best, but I did not want to fill up on that anyway.  There was a decent wine selection and full bar for drinks.  Drinks have nice flavor but are not made strong, so if you are a booze hound, you've been warned.  The prices are medium-high, not outrageous for a restaurant in this area.  Finally the entertainment. This is just an added bonus that takes the restaurant to the next level.  You can enjoy Spanish guitar and Flamenco while dining? Yes. And it is fantastic.  Be aware, some people come just to enjoy the music, so there will be people hovering about the tables during the performance. It can get a bit crowded near stage (bordering on claustrophobic).  And while I enjoyed the atmosphere-some people might not. But if you love live music and the energy that comes with it, you wont be disappointed.  Definitely worth a visit or three. Muy bien!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Paella de Pollo
Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Flamenco
Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Table Setting

iWZeUCHI014QGvKcaXkHgA.text: Wonderful ambience..very romantic. Amazing food (get the pallela) and amazing staff! Everyone there was very attentive and friendly. I will definitely be coming back with my girlfriends and for a date night with my boyfriend.

8uRC64A_sDFwpEBs4d5vIg.text: Dear lord this place was awful. I wanted to chew my leg off to escape. The worst tapas place I've been to. I'm shocked this place has higher ratings. I feel snobby but people must have zero experience at tapas restaurants. First, the ambience is like Disney World. The food is awful. Pre-cooked and soaking in oil. Everything tastes like oil. The owners must have got some deal on mini cast iron pans. Everything tastes like nothing. No flavor just grease. The folks at the door make such a scene when you get there that you feel like you'd make a bigger scene if you left. So you're trapped at this ridiculous place.

1_knOfFQ0t_6tArWSRmLOA.text: the review stating HH is no longer relevant as they don't have one anymore.  maybe during the summer.  said didn't bring in any more business.  hmmm.    had reservations and seated promptly.  as to the dining experience, fantastic ambiance and the place is big and very nicely decorated inside & out.  the only thing i noticed was the chairs had some stains.  nice view seating outside.  service was great.  we had 4 tapas total..and pitcher of sangria.  the tapas stuffed portabello with goat cheese was very small and had a bitter taste.  neither one of us liked it.  i asked for a recommendation for tapas and the apple bacon wrapped medjool dates stuffed with rosemary queso was fabulous if you like dates.  for desert, we had the chocolate swirl cake with condensed milk sauce.  the presentation was superb but it was bland.  the whipped cream or cream sauce really helped but i wouldn't order it again.      overall, i'd highly recommend this place and try some of the other tapas.  an added pLUS was the flamenco dancing and music :)

4jxzMtWbcrvREogHaWbKQw.text: The outdoor patio atmosphere was awesome. It's a relaxing and charming ambience in a great location.  The tapas were disappointing. We ordered a variety but felt like they were all somewhat generic and seemed hastily put together, and the ingredients didn't seem fresh. Overall, what arrived was not as appealing as what we envisioned from the menu.  The Paella was good though, and so was the Sangria.    Not sure we would go back.

kNsM8GtA1Jgt9-GkTPUsXQ.text: The first time we visited this restaurant (September 2013) we weren't incredibly impressed.  The hostess was pleasant but our waitress wasn't the friendliest or most helpful.  We were seated inside and the band was playing.  The band was so loud our table couldn't carry on a decent conversation without feeling like we were yelling at each other.   Someone in our party asked for a recommendation and had some questions regarding a menu item.  The waitress  gave a brief description of the item and basically suggested "it's up to you" (most of the time when this question is asked, the wait staff usually answers with a "my favorite on the menu is....).    At this point we'd had it with the yelling so we asked if a table outside was available.  Luckily, there was, so we moved outside.  It was a little better outside (noise-wise) and the patio has a nice vibe with the lighting and the waterway.  The food was mediocre....nothing special or memorable.  Our second visit was in April 2014.  We thought we'd give this place another chance so we went in for an after dinner drink.  Again, the hostess was pleasant and we asked to be seated outside since we knew it would be loud inside and the band was already playing.  We were seated at the same table as before.  Our waiter, Jorge P., was unbelievably rude from the start.  My girlfriend asked if the restaurant had any cocktail specialties.  In a tone that sounded like he was being put out, he basically pointed to the menu and rattled off the names of common cocktails on the menu.  When my girlfriend ordered a vodka (Stoli) and grapefruit, he SNAPPED, "This isn't a nightclub.....we don't carry Stoli !!".  He said "Grey Goose and grapefruit" (of course the most expensive vodka) in a "that's it--I'm ordering for you" tone.   When my husband ordered 2 white wines, he answered in an annoyed voice, "Why don't you make my life easier and just order the bottle?".   He tried to up-sell each one of us.  The only reason they got 2 stars was because the hostess was decent to us both times, the food was mediocre and the outside patio is nice.  We won't return to this restaurant or recommend it.

e19540i1FaRFCfV01eReYQ.text: When the band is so loud that I can't talk to my friends it makes me think that this restaurant is not made for socialising.   When the food is late and it doesn't taste at all good I wonder about what they see as restaurant quality service.   When it is so hot inside it makes me think they don't care about the customers needs.   When they have a $15 service charge on the bill after recognising poor service it makes me think they only want me their for my money and not my patronage.   When I think of this restaurant it makes me think they are way behind all the other local restaurants.

AP3CQMiN_4bMn6pVms5APQ.text: Absolutely the worst service!!  We weren't very hungry. We just wanted to share a Paella. She basically starts trying to force us to get a sampler. The up selling was ridiculous.  When our food came they came and dropped off all this food we did not order. 10 mins later the waitress came and we told her we didn't order it. She said yes we did and got pissed at us!!! Grabbed the food and finally came back with our paella 30 mins later.

ACRunlhuK7A1qPU3PCuaVA.text: I rather enjoyed trying this place with the company of my friend and her family.  They ordered everything for us so I don't know the names of everything we had; but everything I tasted was great. We had a mix of meat and vegetarian dishes. I typically don't like bacon-wrapped things, but there were bacon-wrapped dates which was my favorite tapa. Too bad it's not on the menu, but I might have luck asking for it in the future.  The staff was very accommodating as we ate a late dinner (after 8:45 pm). Dishes came out quickly and at a steady pace. I will gladly come back.

Iw0AzMsbr62smj3qbWv86g.text: We reserve for  party of eight teen people.Service was definitely lacking.  Server was very rude! Only thing I like was the dancer and musicians.  Definitively never come back!

i-LNvCMsEZ3c9olhDeSz8Q.text: A friend recommended this place, so I decided to dine there one evening. The place is romantic, quaint, and the ambiance outside was just lovely.  They had a lot of options, but it wasn't amazing. I would give it 3.5 stars if that was an option.   I ordered the Gambas al Pil-Pil Sauteed gulf shrimp, garlic, guindilla white wine - it was tasty, but nothing I haven't had before. The Pimiento Piquillo con Centollo - Crab stuffed peppers in a saffron sauce. It was small and nothing special. Sure, I ate it, but it was ok and presentation could be improved. The Pollo Rebozado Thin pound chicken breast with tomatoes and herbs was one of my favorites. Good portion, flavorful, it reminded me of a chicken piccata. The Solomillo Moruno*- Grill Tenderloin of beef with adobo was a disappointment. It was tough and lacked a great flavor. They should focus more on the flavor vs presentation. The Miarmones Open-face empanada with iberico apple bacon, goat cheese and basil was a large portion and it had a lot of great flavors. Similar to a pizza, a must have! Topped it with bacon wrapped dates, just ok, it had a lot of Rosemary cream stuffed in it. I enjoyed my evening, I just had better tapas in the valley, so I'm not quite sure I would return.

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lovely ambiance!

aGlWRbqUMFGZQ00J_AZsHQ.text: A few of us stopped by here after work for a little food and drink. We went buck-crazy and ordered a ton of Tapas. Here's what we ordered: Patatas Bravas ~ Spicy Potato wedges (Burgos) $4.95 yelp.com/biz_photos/-9na... Chorizo ~ Red Pepper Sausage (Rioja) $5.50 yelp.com/biz_photos/-9na... Tigres ~ Steamed Mussels in a spicy Hot Sauce (Basque) $7.00 yelp.com/biz_photos/-9na... Rabas ~ Tender Calamari Rings, club soda batter (Basque) $6.00 yelp.com/biz_photos/-9na... Almondigas con Tomate ~ Spanish Meatballs in a roasted Tomato Sauce (Murcia) $6.00 yelp.com/biz_photos/-9na... Croquetas de Jamon y Queso ~ Ham and Cheese Croquettes (New Castille) $5.00 yelp.com/biz_photos/-9na... Rabo de Buey ~ Oven roasted Ox Tail with Carrots, Roasted Peppers, and Tempranillo Wine Sauce (Basque) $19.00 yelp.com/biz_photos/-9na... Chuletilla de Cordero ~ Open flame-broiled Lamb Chops with Herbs (Old Castile) $10.00 yelp.com/biz_photos/-9na... Gambas al Pil-Pil ~ Sauteed Gulf Shrimp, Garlic, Guindilla Pepper, White Wine (Andalucia) $8.00 yelp.com/biz_photos/-9na... Cordero Burgales ~ Lamb Ossobucco, castille style (Castilla la vieja) $24.00 yelp.com/biz_photos/-9na... We grubbed and drank Wine all night long. What a great after-work dinner! Good thing I didn't pick up the bill that night! Return Factor - 100%

5YrKjxktSRQ4ymqYeJJSrg.text: Excellent Tapas.  Had the salmon, just ok but service and atmosphere was excellent.  Beef was also excellent.  Flamenco dancing was outstanding.

oMshHHfGycXvuA--DPaiyA.text: Visited Tapas Papas Fritas based on a recommendation from a friend who also loves Spanish food. This place did not disappoint. Went on Mothers day, seated promptly and was given a great table outside on the patio. Great view and atmosphere. We ordered several tapas, all were delicious and good portions. Ordered the Paella Valenciana and was just the flavors I expected. But, was rather small. It was certainly enough for one, but if you are thinking of ordering a paella and sharing you may want to think about ordering more tapas. You will not be disappointed with your meal. Service was above excellent!!

Yfd5kK5mF6Tj14hFc2qqTA.text: I went with a group for Restaurant Week last Saturday during the Flamenco dancing. I made a reservation (group of 10) and I called and changed it a few times and they were very friendly and accommodating.  Most of us ordered from the Restaurant Week menu. They were really hesitant to give us a normal menu and it took several requests before they gave us one.   I chose the Mahi Mahi dish. The tapas that came out before the meal were amazing. There was this goat cheese stuffed date with bacon that might actually be one of the best things I've ever put in my mouth. There was also a pepper stuffed with crab that was amazing. The Mahi Mahi, unfortunately, was overcooked. It had a great date salsa on top though and the accompanying risotto was quite tasty.   One of my friends had the Paella special and she let me try some. It was very, very good. Another friend had rabbit and it was dry and inedible.  I chose to go during the Flamenco dancing but I think that was a mistake. There was a singer and it was so incredibly loud we all had a headache by the end of the night and none of us could hear each other. It kind of put a damper on our evening. It would have been so much better if they had cranked the volume down a bit.  And last, but not least, the service. It took 3 hours to get through dinner. My friend with the overcooked rabbit didn't get his meal for almost 10 minutes after the rest of us got our food. Our server was visibly angry that I asked him to split the checks. One of my friends ordered a drink she never got.  So, three stars because some of it was amazing, some of it sucked. I'd like to try again on a weeknight when it's slow.,

im-eXKZ0NRpEgLHlfQUrcA.text: Amazing tapas and the live Flamenco made our dinner a wonderful and memorable experience. The Gambas al Ajillo were off the charts and the Pan Noli did not disappoint. Thanks for a lovely evening!

G8MHp3Rze9c47FegYHV1PA.text: Have been here a few times and each time ended up getting the tasting menu, it's exceptional.  Reasonably priced, great food, good service, good atmosphere, I can't recommend this place enough.  Wine was reasonably priced as well, everything was great.

Ibt9wueRin3lJyHHyoPauA.text: Delicious food and great entertainment  I loved it so much, I took my mom there for her birthday.

iyo0bSNTu5wQIvHHw71lCA.text: Love it! I'm a huge fan of tapas in general but this place is really special. Food is great...especially the snails! House made sangria is to die for. Great service, the bartender, Aaron, remembered my name on my second visit. Live music Friday and Saturday nights was really fun. Kudos guys! I can't wait to bring all my friends. I was even raving about the food to my customers this weekend!

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Snails in a sherry sauce (caracoles aioli)

K0-eIrR4dmVCdbzmsNaGMA.text: I'll have to back for the food.   But if you are just looking for Flamenco, some libations in a urban casual atmosphere it is better at The Crescent Ballroom (6p-8pish) on Saturdays.  Not a compensated endorsement.  I love me some Flamenco and seek out places who have regular performances.  Watching it at TPF was difficult because sitting at the bar is really the only place to watch it on its small stage and you have to dodge the waitstaff as they come and go to serve the patrons on the patio.   The night we were there there was a bachelorettte party in a large table to the right of the stage and it was really tacky to listen to them yelling "Shot....Shot...Shot" as the performance was occurring.    I would have to go back to see how the food compares to what I enjoyed while in Spain.

qkvQwt9DBjIl32WVYeHs3Q.text: Hands down the food is great.  If you like  tapas, paella, wine and slow service like you are an American in Barcelona than hit up this place. I waited for a tenador "fork" until my food was cold, had multiple tapas brought to the table which we didn't order that they came back 5 minutes later and removed from the table. Still waiting for the Digestive "drink of the night" and I've already gave my credit  card. I now know my waiter name "Jorge" as its on the credit card receipt.

XliWkjVsw7cdp8NyEwDpsA.text: The place was beautiful and excellent location at the old town Scottsdale,  waterfront.  That's why I'm giving it 2 stars instead of one. That being said, here's all the negative parts. We were there for a birthday party, a large group and we had reservation.  But we had to wait for our table for 30 minutes at the bar until I went and complained to the management to get our table. The whole dinner was about 4 hrs, and 3 and a half was for waiting for our orders,  appetizers,  food, drinks, water, even the damn check.  The waiter was flamboyant but kinda rude, did not listen to our request.  He refused to split our bills even though we requested several times. And the long awaited food was complete disappointment.  EVERYTHING was extra salty. There's a live Spanish band with flamingo dancer inside the restaurant,  which was entertaining at the beginning but after 4 hrs, it got extremely loud to the point,  we can't even hear ourselves talk anymore.  Needless to say, we will not be back again.

OhSWIzmi0FnozQINBMgKhA.text: My husband and I love this restaurant and have been coming here consistently for a couple years. We have never had any issues with the service, even on their busiest nights. They have a wonderful selection of tapas and our favorites are the oxtail, rabbit, anything with chorizo, bacon-wrapped dates, escargot, and the mussels. They also have entrees and their paellas and especially the fideua are AMAZING. Their vegetable dishes are somewhat bland to me, but I've never had a problem with not ordering vegetables the next time around LOL. On the weekend they have live entertainment. The guitarists and the flamenco dancer are so talented and amazing to watch.

rJVruxKWqze6WfwRXDe6gg.text: I love this place!  I would come here every night they have Flamenco dances if I could cause I love Flamenco!  The food here is pricy for tapas, but I'm not going to complain cause I thought overall it's pretty good. I didn't know what my friend ordered, but it was music to my palate while I savor the moment as I watched the Flamenco dancer sway, move, and stomp with a passion!  Must need strong thighs and calves I gather.  We ordered some finger potatoes with a creamy cilantro aioli, escargot in a red marinara, and some cherry tomatoes salad -- Yum Yum and Yum!  The service was pretty good overall, but both host looks like they were hit mans! No disrespect, but tone it down. Suits are great, but I would go with all black with black tie to give that 5 star service flare.  Ambience was great!  What can I say play some Flamenco music and yes you had me at hello! - Enjoy!

EOkxdA0grSJuMJWPSHbFYw.text: My family loves this place! We always go on the nights where they have music or flamenco dancing. The service is great and authentic and they have never gotten an order wrong before. We usually do an assortment of tapas (the bacon wrapped dates are a must) and then the paella for everyone to share. If you are going on a night to see dancing make sure to make a reservation and state that you would like to have a view of the stage in order to get a good spot. The last time we went we were a little disappointed to have been stuck in a corner by the bathroom and didn't have the best view of the flamenco dancer and band but we could still hear the music.

9uY5c5n9JDNyQ1lQ9uNeeA.text: I was disappointed, the bartender was extremely rude.  Not going back.  It takes one person to ruin an experience and she did just that.

k79XATLuLoHuhlOc_8EJ4g.text: Went there tonight and all I can say is wow! I am from Spain and this food took me home. The food, the music,  the flamenco and decoration were wonderful! We ordered some tapas and they were sooo good and also the paella was delicious! The patatas bravas were one of the best and also the calamares. Highly recommended!!!!

KrpmeeWQs8e6MagD3fGX_g.text: Great place and great service, waiters were super attentive and the food is just perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lamb chops and crab and eggplant tapas. Yummy and delish, very satisfied with this size, bigger not always better. #lovetapas

cuY1a99J8KrVqwkILfTH6g.text: I'll give it 4 stars, more like 3.5 but as you know there is no option. Very busy, view to the street and the river some people say you can't even see it, if you seat outside there is loud people walking around, if u seat inside even louder with the live music and silverware noises so pick your poison. On the good side, the food was good not the best, service was good could be better it was really a good/ok experience, the kid who was the server helper was even better than the server himself. More like 3.5 Stars. I personally won't come back with so many other choices around

vXUaG6lNXea4jVNfJ4TgRQ.text: This place was SUPER good. The first time we came we did the chefs choice menu which was more food than you could ever imagine. The paella was so good and all of the Tapas were worth it. The second time we picked our own tapas and it was equally as good.

9g7qnhGER8V0q7p-iad0hw.text: What a great place! As son as you walk in, you are transported to Spain! The energy in the restaurant is incredible, we definitely enjoyed our evening! We ordered the chef special and we were not disappointed! The singers and dancers were great!

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

vYR1q-DWaXaOV3G6Ktcfkg.text: Wow! I can't believe I haven't been here prior to this. My husband and I and some friends met here for dinner last Saturday night before heading to the comedy club and we loved it. We ordered tapas, plate after plate of goodness.  I don't remember the Spanish names but the english translation: beef tenderloin skewers, Spanish potato pie, shrimp, dates wrapped in bacon, ham and cheese croquettes, chorizo sausage, saffron rice, and more. And don't forget the bread basket! Warm and freshly baked and served with a garlic aioli for dipping that is amazing! We filled and up on the tapas and bread and did not get to try the paella which looked amazing. Next time! PS Service was great and prices very reasonable.

ky0auqwSEOsz8e8cpCSEUA.text: Nice ambiance on the patio,  good music, felt rushed. Patatas bravas, traditionally served with a sauce, are not served with a sauce here. Other tapas were pretty good. Incredibly nice hosts, server so-so. A table behind us was asked to leave because another party was coming.

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

VDukZoFyxHcXod54IWeDuw.text: We had a party of 5 my daughters birthday dinner. We enjoyed the food but we definitely order too much food. I would give the food a 41/2 stars. My problem is that we ordered a bottle of wine. The first bottle I ordered from the wine list they did not have in stock. So I went to a second choice the price of the wine was $75. I had not problem with the price. I buy and collect wine. Curiously I looked up the wine on Vivino. The retail price for the wine is $14.97.  The regular price for wine in a restaurant is double retail. The price of the wine in the restaurant is outrageous. The restaurant should be embarrassed for charging this price. I will call the manager today to complain.

Dv3347LVwR-fbO9wUIjsvA.text: Really loud, obnoxious music too many days per week. Food isn't worth the price. Great location, I just wish the space was used for something different.

Gq2yZXTzhMxXCVfG-GHl0w.text: Bad service, food was below average and took way too long to prepare. I really  was looking fwd to eating here but ended up disappointed. Unless you want to waste money and time pick from one of the many better options in old town. Not a good choice for business or personal entertainment. I love wine and the wine selection over priced.  TPF you can do better, work on that.

EkjoioN5LdKQKcqPBXtclQ.text: Food was great, we ordered a bunch of tapas and a Paella for 3 people. We came on Friday so they had Live flamenco music. Our server was good but we wanted to highlight the real star of our great experience, the busboy. He went above and beyond to make sure that nothing was missing. He has a very positive attitude and was on top everything. Kudos to Domanic! We will come again because of him.

HJgq9ymVhllcajSTBHVnlw.text: Now, although this can add up quickly, I believe the experience and location are worth the cost.  Visually set on the Scottsdale Waterfront walkway, both the ambiance and setting are awesome!   Most Tappas items are meant to share. Order three or four dishes and compare notes. I went after the Paella with chicken. The portion is large and it was quite enjoyable. There was enough on my entree to share with three people.   If you sit towards the front of the restaurant, you appear to be high above the drag and look down on the Scottsdale ongoing.  Outback aligns you at ground level with those walking the path, exercising and influx of curious tourists.  There are a ton of other venues around you to absorb "coffee, ice cream, art, pizza etcetera." Scottsdale Fashion Square is a short 1/4 mile jaunt over the bridge. More shops there than you can take in and the best people watching in the area. That may actually be the best part! Funny stuff here!  Try out Tappas. Great Chef and Brazilian influence. Do it smart and split dishes. Mucho Comida Amigos!  #Irishcatv2 #Vinosquared #Vino2ultimate #Vino2 #Rebelfoodandwine

csOvMHb_ZVhTvlF8XEXd7g.text: Stumbled on this place a month ago and have already been back twice. There are aloe of tapas to choose from so can be overwhelming but the waiters are great with direction. The lamb, and crab peppers are great! Then we have the Valenciana paella which has been a favorite. Also, love the atmosphere there's great seating whether inside our outside and at night they have live music!

81pqXTm1Vilp1wZpFm17CQ.text: First time at Tapas Papa Frita, the service was exceptional! And the food was delicious! Our waiter made sure we always had water/drinks. We tried about 7 different tapas and they were all delicious. Although, the best part with the dessert, I highly recommend the flan, it was made perfect! Overall, a great experience!

jZYn7xwRKiW0h4IJVo_Zug.text: There is absolutely nothing wrong with this place!! From Chef Joseph seating is outside to see the entertainment to the wine selection...impeccable!! Love LOVE it here!!

G1rteNX1H3G5So2MNknC8Q.text: This is definitely a recommended restaurant if you are looking for European fine food. It's a pleasant surprise for me in this city.

L_Sa8_izKRhkVZxSmlWJLQ.text: Great spanish tapas. Some things weren't quite what we were expecting but others were great.

JiicWPuuMaq14AlCkW1xyg.text: If you can't swing a trip to Spain and are looking for a chance to get away in a romantic yet lively restaurant unlike anywhere else in Scottsdale- you need to go to Tapas Papa Fritz. Actually... even if you can go to Spain or have no interest go for the food, wine and entertainment REGARDLESS. The restaurant is right on the canal waterfront which adds to the great date night vibe as outdoor seating has string lights and on some nights a band outside. I once went and they had a spanish guitar band that was so good and played such a range of romantic and fun songs I instantly thought of it being a perfect wedding band. The indoor has interesting decor that could be considered spanish or Tuscan and huge candles that have been lit off the remnants of a million other candles that came before it. The different colors of wax make a beautiful visual to take your attention while you check in with the hostess. The stage has flamenco mostly Saturday's i believe that seems truly authentic not hokey. The dancers are extremely serious and talented. The food is phenomenal overall I can't say I've had a bad dish. I usually go with the patatas bravas which are like potato wedges with a spicy tomato sauce and aioli. And then you can't go without having a Paella (I've been happy with chicken, vegetable and seafood. One downside is the service I've gone many times and if anything on a good day service is fair and on a bad day you see your waiter every 20 min which is frustrating. The menu is huge which i love as everyone can find a tapa they like but one downside is most tapas are pretty pricey and genuinely are one or two bites (True tapas). I recommend getting a tapa with a glass of wine then putting in your paella order - they'll also give you bread if you ask ! :) 5 stars for full experience

pmVC95w8ra1kjBes2_WTvA.text: First time here, we sat in the patio listening the live music on Thursday night and drink the red sangria, it was beautiful!  We've been told by our waiter that they have flamenco performance in the weekend, that's I want to see in the future.  The inside tables were empty but the patio were full, I guess everyone wanted to listen the live music outside and enjoy the nice weather.  Since we weren't hungry we shared corsuela diablo, seafood combo in spicy tomato sauce and it was delicious, but I wish the portion is little bit bigger.

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The patio seatings was beautiful.
Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sarsuela diablo, seafood combo in spicy tomato sauce.
Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Red sangria, it was small.

41RD8iUkZaMzE5exeTkxrQ.text: I have had a long-standing craving for authentic Spanish Tapas and Paella ever since my trip to Spain during my college years.  After researching online for any Spanish restaurants (most google searches will yield Mexican and Latin establishments even if you put "Spanish"), I finally found Tapas Papa Frita on the page of a yellow Yelper and decided to give it a shot. As soon as the fiancee and I stepped inside, it was almost like being transported to a hole in the wall place inside the Catalan countryside.  We were greeted with the loud music and dancing of a flamenco band in the center stage and the interior of the restaurant was built to replicate an old Spanish villa.  We were promptly seated and attended to despite it being a busy Saturday night.  For a busy old-town Scottsdale establishment on a weekend night, we received EXCELLENT service from both our servers the first and second times we visited.  Our server from the first visit, Vincent, was very friendly and helpful in helping us choose out which Tapas were the best for my fiancee who was a first-timer to authentic Spanish cuisine.  We ordered the chef's special Taste of Spain which was five Tapas orders and a Valencia Paella for two.  Every Tapa was delicious, but the one that stood out the best were the bacon-covered dates (which were not on the menu but provided to us by the chef).  The Paella was enormous, extremely flavorful, and True to the Paellas I had eaten back in the old Spanish Valencian villages.  We also ordered a pitcher of Red Sangria which Vincent was always promptly filling our glasses with, as he stated that he would not allow our glasses to stay empty.  The ambience of the restaurant was very friendly and warm, and even with the loud flamenco dancing and music, my fiancee and I were still able to enjoy an intimate and relaxed Saturday date night dinner.  Our second visit was what really sealed the deal for us with this establishment.  This time, we were attended to by Laura, who was being kept very busy by multiple tables throughout the evening.  As it was a busy Saturday night as well, not only did Laura take a little time to take our orders, however our food did not come out for at least 30-40 minutes after order.  As my fiancee and I knew how busy it got at this place, we did not mind the wait and ordered some drinks while taking in the flamenco performance.  It was during this time when Laura came over and offered a couple of free drinks on the house; apparently the table next to us was occupied by your typical high-maintenance and snobby Scottsdale family who were giving the poor girl a ton of grief because they were not being serviced hand-to-mouth and sending drinks back.  This same family also sent back multiple food plates and verbally abused Laura for the perceived poor preparation of food in the meantime.   We did not mind the wait and let Laura know to take her time as we both knew how difficult and obnoxiously annoying the typical Scottsdale natives were.  To our surprise, not only did Laura hook us up with putting all of our drinks on the house, but Joseph, who was the chef/owner of the place, came by our table to personally apologize for the wait for the food and to thank us for treating his server so kindly through the whole situation.  He then ordered us a couple of custom liquer drinks that looked like miniature beer mugs and toasted with us for a wonderful evening and to us as a couple.  The paella came out perfect despite the wait (we ordered the Arros Negre) and both Joseph and Laura informed us to ask for them during our next visit.  Overall, this place is one of the best restaurants my fiancee and I have eaten at in the Valley, and one of our designated spots for a romantic date night during free weekends.  It is too bad that this gem is located inside the dung nest of posers and house-poor entitled worthless shells of human beings who live on credit cards that is known as Scottsdale, however it is worth attempting to walk through the hordes of these walking scum to enjoy this piece of Espana inside Arizona.

pgFr2U9ZGx6hfhkS3ao-Og.text: The service was horrible. We waited 15 minutes to get our drinks (cappuccino). After 1.5 hours only two of our tapas dishes had arrived at our table. We mentioned this to the woman appearing to be floor manager, and she did nothing to make our experience better. The Tapas is basic. The location is great. There aren't many tapas places to contend with... And they serve mediocrity. I've given this restaurant a few chances... Hoping it would get better. Nope.

MDboxIAp3CCLhZjCKcTLFw.text: 4.5. If prices were a little friendlier I'd give it a full 5.... Maybe even 5.5 :) you can't go wrong with anything, but you MUST include the goat cheese stuffed dates, txistorra and the churro w/ chocolate if you want to have an absolutely amazing time. Their sangria is bomb. On weekends there's live music/dancing. The owner is from Spain. He knows what he's doing :)

r1OlnPC6o4BFrvK7wCjvYg.text: Been a couple of times here now I wish I could do tapas all week I've never been disappointed with a dish here Even if I don't like them I usually have to admit it's because the flavors aren't for me but still extremely well prepared My favs are the tigres, conejo, leek tart and any of the shrimp dishes

r6m22TvDN_rplUdMLubPEA.text: Our service was ok but we had a bartender wait on us because the waiter in the section could not handle his tables. All the tables around us were complaining about not getting food or drinks. I think we lucked out. The food was ok. The paella was not good at all. It was salty and wet. Paella should be dry but this was more like wet rice.  I think they heat their paella up by putting it in a pan and then adding broth. Maybe that is the only way to keep up with the demand. Anyways it was not very good. Also the band playing made it impossible to sit inside. You could not hear the person next to you without screaming. That is why we chose outside. It does have a nice patio, but so do a lot of other restaurants nearby. That is why next time I will try somewhere else.

FxAqd-WqYLxtBDgdSlS4iA.text: As someone who has lived in Spain and loves the culture and the food, I am picky about my Iberian culinary adventures.  And as much as you'd think tapas would be a fantastic choice for a meal, for one reason or another the whole concept often tends to get lost in translation with the food barely resembling its Spanish counterpart.  Having been disappointed by another Spanish restaurant in Scottsdale that I won't name here, I was cautious about Papa Frita as I got there for my birthday.    Luckily the place was a pleasant surprise!  The mood was great, great lighting and atmosphere.  Our party of 20+ was accommodated with no problems and set at a large table in the middle of the floor.  Flamenco dancing was in full swing.  We settled for a taster menu and got about half a dozen different tapas each leading up to the seafood paella.  While the bill was pretty pricey (may be 3x what it would have cost in Spain), it was pretty much in line or even a bit less than a typical Spanish restaurant.  Overall, good stuff.  Great for very large parties too, as it's difficult to find places like this in Scottsdale.

iHp6H2JP9qz2LQLXAGD0bg.text: I was a little hesitant to try this restaurant after reading some of the negative (and strange) reviews but I'm so glad I did!  The restaurant is beautiful and the patio is perfect with trees and little lights overhead.  Two of us went for an early dinner and had two-for-one wines and a half-priced appetizer of sherried mushrooms before splitting the Valencia paella at the server's suggestion ("lots of people order an appetizer or two and then split a paella").  Along with the complimentary hot bread and garlic aioli, it was plenty of food for a very reasonable price.  The paella was excellent.  If you read down the reviews, several people had sticker shock when they ordered the chef's special.  Maybe because of those issues, the chef's special was listed on a separate menu handed to us with the price clearly listed at $45 per person.  It includes a ton of food.  But, the paella we split was $20 and with happy hour pricing on the drinks and appetizer, our total bill before tip was $58.  Not bad.  We'll definitely be back.

BZKHEcCrr3_aU5Xl027dYw.text: After Iruna closed I was looking for something like this. While not as urban and chic as Iruna was, Tapas is a top shelf contender with a menu that will blow your mind. We tried lamb, mushroom, shrimp, crab, asparagus, and chicken dishes - all were cooked to perfection. The crab stuffed peppers and lamb chops were my favorites. I suggest the patio if the weather is nice.

knGcyqXMvrEV1L54PDqY9Q.text: We need more places like this! How fun, how authentic. I felt like I was back in Spain again. I can't rate the entree items, the apps were so great we shared 10 of them and never got to the main course.  Great atmosphere, even in the summer heat the patio was fun for people watching and drinking.  I am picky, as my other reviews indicate, but this is a winner.

-0s4k01U4Y_ruYqyrLOppg.text: Stayed with a cheese plate.  The malbec is nice.  The Alhambra beer was a hit.  Lamp chops were tasty.  Oxtail was wonderful.  Apple crisp excellent.  Nice evening.

nLTLsY1aaJDiJqdAnhbbKg.text: I'd like to start off by saying how excited I was for a night of tapas and margs with my boys on the greenbelt. Despite the overall rating we still decided to give this place a try, boy were we wrong- 45 min wait BETWEEN plates, and seemingly cheap margaritas recommended by the waiter that ended up being $17 per. Bottom line. 3-3.5 is perfect for this place.

cPnL5Eifp292Hn0aIVhbkQ.text: Okay perhaps this is a poor analogy, but unlike MacArthur, I shall NOT return.  The only redeeming thing at this restaurant was the amazing flamenco music and dancers.  The lamb chop tapas were not very flavorful and overall the service was abysmal.

wyLCT9Z5zXLdERykFUsM6w.text: The atmosphere at this restaurant is upbeat and the entertainment is great. The dessert and service however, left much to be be desired. We had a Cappuccino, Flan and Brazo Gitano. All three were incredibly mediocre. The flan was barely ok and the Brazo Gitano was extremely dry. Both had an overpowering alcohol/liqueur taste. But the service from our server was what left the worst taste of all. Incredibly rude and so aloof. Won't be coming back there again.

7JDX2dzP7jLIfFejAFTEsQ.text: This restaurant is one of the best (if not the best) in the area. The service is great as well as the staff. The food is fantastic and very authentic, as the chef himself is from Bilbao. The quality of food is up there with some of the best restaurants in New York City, except not the New York prices.

2IYizSZu5n0Rczb_Tw9nLg.text: My husband and I went for AZ restaurant week and then decided we'd rather order tapas instead. We got five, and they were all very tasty. Small plates, yes, but five of them filled us up (or the two baskets of bread with the delectable, creamy dipping sauce did...probably that). Either way, we liked the shrimp and artichoke/chickpea dip tapas the most. They were a little pricey compared to portion size, but they were very delicious, so I'd recommend.  We loved the white sangria the most. Big, cold, perfect pitcher. The only thing not perfect? The price. $36 for a pitcher of sangria. Alas, it is Scottsdale, so you accept it.  Lastly, we went on a Saturday night. There was flamenco dancing with Spanish guitar. Entertaining and enjoyable. Part of me wishes we sat out on the patio, though, because it seemed more romantic and the weather was lovely.

D6uhXiTXacVhktNhGiSCtA.text: Food is delicious. Flamenco dancer was really good, but the guitarist singing made it complete.

Uu3QM2jPK2tafyxEGasWLw.text: Had several plates of the Tapas...all types...here with 2 new friends..great atmosphere....the food was great..waiter great..beer selection limited...could have sat on the patio in July evening..misters really cooled it down.. Churros were excellent... $200+ for all 4 of us...worth it...music and entertainment was fun....

7RQQuKBPbSRj2txJG257Ww.text: Be prepared to wait... Wait... Wait! The food takes forever to come! Service was mediocre, ambiance was okay and music was pretty awesome but the wait time takes away from actually enjoying your dining experience. The food however, was awesome and delicious. I hope they find a better system with how they expedite their food service.

8DlR0TwUaeyeYvWVCRj_ug.text: THE best tapas in the area! Definitely comparable to the real deal (I studied abroad in northern Spain so I always have a craving for tapas!) Order the croquetas and paella, to die for!

Zu-Rr6rwC9cRfG5Y0GGz1Q.text: IF YOU WANT TO LEAVE IN AN AMBULANCE: And end up in the ER all night (after fainting and going into convulsions) like both my other half and my friends wife did on Friday night, right after their meal...then go ahead and risk your entire weekend (and possibly life, depending on your age) by eating this terribly low quality, toxic, unsanitary, poisonous food...and enjoy the bill at full price with not a single item removed or even an simple I'm sorry from anyone in the restaurant. Worst experience ever! Ruined our birthday dinner and everyone's weekend. And both girls still don't feel right 5 days later...

vVVZBA9lU1RU7o5uhcAbuQ.text: One of our favorite restaurants in Arizona! Met Chef/Owner Joseph when we came in and he was delightful. We had the chefs tasting menu and everything was delicious!! Service was on point, great wine list, ambiance is romantic and we love the live music and dancing on weekend evenings. One of our favorite date night places to go!!

k1BfbE7Ctx1n80PsAaoAnw.text: A fantastic evening of great food, wine and entertainment. Waitress Tiffany was so on top of making total evening perfect. We shared Chef tapas and Valencia style paella....tapas 5 star paella...expected crusty socarrat but that is more Barcelona style. Still excellent flavor throughout but I did want more rice .   Flamenco  dancing near table side as we enjoyed expresso, churros dipped in dark rich chocolate sauce with side of bubbly aperitif...absolutely great night.  All staff members from bar keep who introduced me to heavenly estrella cerveza to young lady receptionist so good they made whole evening a absolute perfect date night.  So impressed I will definitively return.

6OciPLDJYMA1sbH15hLTkg.text: Great ambiance and live music. I personally enjoy it better when is packed as the service seems more on point. You can really tell the difference in the food when Chef Jose is working the kitchen. He is truly an amazing chef and can make any dish. This time around I went, the food was marginal and the restrooms were in disarray. We tried to call to make a reservation for Mother's Day and we were turned away, they said they already had over 200 ppl reserved. So we went the weekend after Mother's Day. The service was great. Our waiter was most accommodating, we had a table of 12. Thank you!!

VRq9lbZaa0SkVYvBq0TYrw.text: Wayyyy too loud. We went there for a birthday and the music and dancing was so loud we had to scream to be heard by the person next to us. If we wanted to go to a dance club that would be different. We asked them to turn it down and they did for 5 minutes. Ruined the night.

J6thgisHQ9KDCkiC98LNmQ.text: We were hungry and we all love tapas so decided to give this a shot. It is a lovely restaurant with a great bar. I'd definitely hang out here if the wine weren't so expensive. Seriously, $10 bottles in the store were priced $40 + here. Ridiculous and shameful. The server did not have much by way of recommendations. She said we should do the "chef's specials"- some pre fixe plan- which did not appeal to us at all. We ordered 2 rounds of tapas. Here's the rundown. Gambas al Pil Pil (spicy shrimp)- Decent but way too heavy on the paprika (and I LOVE paprika) and tasted burnt Gambas al Ajillo (garlic shrimp)- Better than the other shrimp dish. I really enjoyed the broth. I'd order this again. Berejenas Con Centollos ~ Layered crab and eggplant tart. This may have been my favorite dish of the night. It was delicious! Albondigas con Tomate ~ Spanish meatballs in a roasted tomato sauce. Pretty good. Way too much sauce though. I think there were 4 meatballs. Patatas Bravas ~ Spicy red potato wedges- I've had better. The sauce was meh and the potatoes had a great crisp exterior but were a bit too mushy in the center. Sopa de Ajo ~Roasted garlic soup, egg drop. This had great flavor but was really salty.  Boquerones ~ Fresh anchovies in a garlic escabeche- My friend loved these but I found them way too fishy. I was not a fan. I love the tapas experience but I would not return here. There are so many more delicious restaurants at your fingertips in Old Town.

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shrimp al Pil Pil- too heavy with paprika and kind of a burned taste
Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Layered crab and eggplant- so much yummier than it looks!

Z23rOoIq8lv2OYNOiKQw-Q.text: What a huge tapas menu and ALL of it was interesting. My friends and I had about ten dishes and they were all deeeeelicious! The owner came over to say hello and chatted with my (real) Spanish friend. He invited her to the restaurant's weekly meeting of Spanish friends. She loved it. We didn't have time to stay for the flamenco dancing and guitar. I console myself by saying "oh that's just for tourists." I would have loved to have seen it and enjoyed the lively scene. This waterfront restaurant is great -- not kitschy or touristy, and the food is good.

g61edPqRNtzYiU2ajv-_yA.text: Returned here for our Anniversary  Dinner.......wonderful time ; mgmt. was most accommodating......out table is just to stage left; perfect view of the fantastic flamenco dancers & fine guitarists !  Great food & bev ...we'll certainly be back !

FKv4djzp8aIT9Bp4rv_wxg.text: Had to try this place. All i can say is WOW!!   The service and food were AMAZING!   I had the chefs special tapas plate. Hubby got the chicken and sausage paella.  Everything was delicious.  The live music and flamenco dancer was the cherry on top!   If you want to have an enjoyable experience and great atmosphere with the freshest ingredients then this is the place to be!

0zrq3MJlyPbRw2pY2w6Dtg.text: 3 stars are for the  two paellas i tried:  diablo 5 and valencia, good flavor.. Tapas are good too ... But service is at 1 star.... First time there drunk server... Second time... Server couldn't  answer menu questions... bussers  are more attentive then servers ....  Try this place for the food....

5C39bM-gXTb5b83--elqlQ.text: Great place.  We sat outside, overlooking the waterfront.  It was perfect for conversing, but we could still hear the live music from inside.  Excellent wait staff.  Food was very good and the small tapas portions allowed us to sample many flavors.

vLEx-cOUmGfdgLSUXC2FOQ.text: Where is the opportunity to post 0 stars?  Awful experience. We don't know what was worse the terrible service, pushy server, dirty tables, dirty menu, nasty food followed by a tummy ache, sangria or was that fruit juice in a highball glass or the wait staff breaking out in a nasty foul mouth fight on the patio in front of many customers?   After a day of thinking about our well earned money that was a total wasted spend, we plan on calling the management and demanding a refund.   Stay. Away.

dKjztYC75R59R3LeZdsw0Q.text: We had dinner here last night! We ordered only three items, basically because it was nearly impossible to get the server's attention. I had a "tomato salad" which consisted of three thin slices of very cold tomato and two very cold balls of goat cheese. Flavors of tomatoes and cheese are not great when cold. My other dish was a prawn, mango and avocado tapas, which was OK. I ordered a glass of Albarino, which is a white wine. What I received was a rose, which didn't taste anything like an Albarino. It was a Friday night and it appeared that the restaurant was adequately staffed, so I don't understand why the service was so bad.

7E2CDmSjAAoUiAuCbLrQ4A.text: It's a good place but I'm not that Impress.  The service is kind a weird the waiters are rushing to much and they tent to mess the order. When I first got there the waiter gave us drinks he said dos you order this? I was like no we just got here.  Then when we order out tapas he gave my friends first then he was walking all over his area with my tapa on his hands asking all the tables if those tapas were them.  He ask us and accidentally he touch the tapa so I ask him to cancel it.  I mean the service is not bad but I think the manager maybe rush them to much to the point that they are all confuse.  The music and the dance is great I like that.   The food was ok but twice I bit a small rock maybe it was from the oysters from my paella I don't know but I didn't like hat part

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Morcilla they are. It that great

FteWJ678eHM173yNK99-AA.text: Went here for a dinner with friends. The food took forever To come out. What's the food came out it wasn't good and smells very fishy. Usually that's a sign of not being fresh. Everyone at the table seem to have a problem with their Entree. I would recommend this place there to there are too many other great places to eat in Scottsdale. Don't waste your time or your money

ugfKNh0wlaDEojFbvelq0A.text: Brought my sister here for lunch along with other friends and family took over an hour to get our dinner. It was cold burnt and we couldn't reorder because she said they where about close, the service was terrible unlike no other. I would never do business there again, or recommend to anyone else.

OTYaBzPiZdPcisnK_5KP-w.text: I would come to Tapas Papa Fritas if I were staying within walking distance in Old Town and really craving tapas, but I would not make a special trip out here. The menu is huge, with plenty of options for vegetarians or for carnivores, but the tapas we ordered were hit and miss. None really blew me away. The most memorable part of the dinner for me was the garlic sauce that came with the bread - I could pour that on everything and not get bored! The sangrias (tried both red and white) were mediocre as was the flan, which was spongey and overlooked. Overall, food was just okay, but not worth what you pay. This might be a decent location for a larger company event, since the dining room is fairly large, but it's not a place I would come for a date or a smaller gathering of friends.

sP72-J8mt8tzT_PR217sqQ.text: Great food and service. Gave them a try for the last night of Restaurant Week and had a nice time. Fantastic tapas, especially the stuffed peppers and paella. Great seating both indoors and on a beautiful patio overlooking the riverwalk area outside,  plus they have live music several nights each week.   The only complaint was that there were several very young children, we found out were with the band, running around everywhere and playing under and around surrounding empty tables. Not exactly what you would expect for this type of restaurant at 9pm when you're trying to enjoy a nice date night. Ok for Chucky Cheese, but not here at these prices, restaurant week or not. We would go back for the food, but find somewhere else if we saw the same situation again.

_RFrJF-1NjI66wNjECp9BQ.text: I wanted to take a good friend of mine to a nice and unique restaurant for her birthday and I found that here! A couple of my friends and I went last weekend. The hostess was sweet and accommodating. I asked if they had the flamingo dancers still performing (which is a big reason why I came here ) so she sat us at a table with a view of the stage. The stage is placed in kind of an awkward corner. If a view of the stage is important to you then definitely put a request before hand. We were lucky since there was one table left with that view. The place was packed until about 9 so I would recommend making reservations too. The server recommend the sparkling sangria which was a hit! We tried a few tapas style dishes which tasted great! The meatballs were possibly my favorite! The flavor and softness was amazingness. The patatas bravas was also delicious and made with a great sauce.  We got a random dish that looked like a vegetarian pot pie. We eventually realized we didn't order this dish but we figured eh let's try something new. It was alright.  As for dessert, the creme brulee was wonderful!  For my friend's birthday they brought out the flan with a sparkler as the candle which was sweet and fun!   The food was overall good. The slow service was another thing. We ended up being late for a movie and at this point of the evening the restaurant wasn't busy.  Overall I would love to come back and def recommend this place. I will probably come when it's cooler to enjoy the patio along the canal. It's also pretty pricey so next visit would have to be for a special occasion too.

dpqsHSjHFGrY53Ln1w-mxg.text: I have been here a few times over the last year bit was disappointed this time.  They don't offer their happy hour specials in the winter.  The bread and white sauce was good as always but the coquettes and paella lack flavor compared to other visits as did the red sangria.  The patio is pet friendly.

7N8aMBxx5rkh67eOVhpVkQ.text: Came in with a group of four. Waitstaff and tapas were fantastic. Have a great selection of vegetable, vegetable / meat (fusion) as they call it and meat based plates along with entrees. Everything we had in this menu was very good. The big miss.... desert. No flavor whatsoever. Had the hazelnut chocolate cheesecake and the apple banana pudding. Underwhelming.   Go for dinner drinks and live music but go somewhere else for desert.

OBfIqOYvmUwbiKGl7NfLeQ.text: great place, food and staff.  they offer 50% off till t he end of summer.

VlWe2Jk7ptQIG98yV0_bcg.text: I had a great time here. We made a large reservation in advance and they were very accomodating. There ended up being more people than we originally thought and they took great care of us.  The service was good, especially from the owner/manager. He made sure to ask us how everything was and shake our hands when we left which I found really refreshing. The server took a while to bring our check, but we were having such a good time talking it really didn't matter.  The atmosphere was great as well. They had a flamenco dancer there and the ladies and I really enjoyed oogling him over the course of the night. He also would teach you how to dance if you wanted to and dragged the two birthdays in our party up on stage to dance with them. He was definitely a highlight of the night.  The food was absolutely delicious. I had one of their specials for the day, which was basically a seafood chippino with a side of safron rice. If I could have, I would have licked the bowl clean the sauce was so good. The bread and dip they give you at the beginning of the meal are also very good. It's really easy to fill up on them. I tried the eggplant and crab tapas my friend got and they were so good. Everyone else seemed to really enjoy their food as well.  The only issue I had here was the bathroom. It wasn't stocked and could have been cleaner.  Besides that, the experience here was pretty wonderful and I'm already planning on dragging some of my friends and family back here.

uP5zL-nwBTRQhvhwifYydw.text: Saturday I had lunch with my girlfriend and her family to celebrate her Mom's bday.  We had a great meal and the weather was perfect on the patio.    Just like my previous visit I loved the food I had oxtail which was amazing and crab stuffed peppers.  Our server Kevin was great and took very good care of us.

lGhfBWRr5CJZlnIteTjedA.text: I had my birthday celebration here.... and it was a FANTASTIC space to celebrate with 40 of my closest friends and family.  Joe and Amber are AWESOME!!!...   They made sure I got what a princess, like me, deserves - as far as TOP-NOTCH customer service.... YUMMINESS and tasty FOOD and DRINKS :)  I ordered 'every-t-h-i-n-g' on the menu without hesitation.... and was not disappointed.  Thank you Amber and Joe!!  I'm a fan of Tapas Papa Frita!!

aS0FZVFb9h9MqQze_PCeNw.text: I've lives in Spain for 3 years and I missed the tapas A LOT so my wife and I went there last night. The food was amazing. Even though the Paella wasn't really spanish( it just had the saffron rice and the seafood, it was obvious that the didn't use fish stock for the rice) I felt like I was in Mallorca again for about an hour and a half. The service was great and the atmosphere was nice,even though it was just a regular Tuesday night.
