6da671h9fFo8WU5iNJZW6w.text: We went there for a friend's birthday party. The place is very nice and the live music was fun. I order their Valencia paella. It was ok but nothing special. I won't crave to have it again.

zBINnM2f5e0X6tvsa-USCw.text: Went there for a dinner and first time experience, was never told that once the music starts it doesnt really stop. It was loud and we were unable to hear each other at the table. Since there were 6 of us we didnt know what to order, everything sounded so yummy. We asked our server and he said, "dont worry i will tell the chef to put some sample tapas together". The tapas were great, everything that he brought out was fantastic. He then brought out a seafood paella, that too was delicious, unfortunately for us, we never asked about the price of anything. To out surprise the check came out to $400, we didnt even have drinks other then ice teas. WAY over priced and very noisy.

zfaioD0Lr6VKz-liaH2bFw.text: I love the food at this place! I actually love alot of things about this place. The only thing is that it can be expensive without you even realizing untill you get the bill. My advice... go for 1/2 price tapas at happy hour! Gazpacho is my favorite only $5. They have this crab stuffed pepper that is to die for.

7TyH74dokdBnkcZrhDkL5A.text: Unimpressive. Server was slow. Portions very small for the money, in spite of being small plates. Won't be back.

p6w6Xct7cig0PUfFpkxRHg.text: Papas tapas are the best in Arizona. Have loved the restaurant for years even when it was on 32nd/camelback.  My wife and I sat at the back of the bar for happy hour.  We got lots of attention from the fantastic bartender. The owner came by and we talked about his native Bilbao and our travels there.  We ate calamari, gambas, Spanish tortilla of potato AND the oxtail!  Amazing flavor and more tender than brisket bbq.  It was a wonderful experience and excellent sangria to boot!

UGUJcaV-1jPwlfHYexZffA.text: Best Spanish cuisine. Tastes very authentic. Their chef is amazing! On weekends, they have flamenco dancers. Very entertaining ambience. One of my favorites

oBC-Y7rKg9iT55Y2hEavnA.text: We stopped in at Tapas Papa Frita after plans to go to another restaurant fell through.  The atmosphere was fun. There was a live entertainment, a band and dancer.  We ordered the chef's 9 plate tasting menu since we were not familiar with the restaurant.  Overall, the food was tasty and prepared well.  The beef in particular was very good.  Our server was really nice but did not check in very often and service was a little slow.  I do recommend trying out the tasting menu.  Oh, and the bread is phenomenal. I would give an extra half star for it if I could.

h8T61QA_jwX9cb1JIbJevg.text: It was a lovely experience- the food, the service, and we sat outside. It was the perfect evening with friends.   Tapas: *Pollo a la Cazadora- chicken, potatoes, carrots. SO GOOD.  *Pimiento Piquillo con Centollo- crab stuffed peppers. Quite tasty.   Paellas: De Pollo ~ Saffron rice with chicken, sausage, tomatoes, onions, garlic, peppers and peas. It was absolutely delicious.   Definitely would recommend this place, and be sure to sit outside!

LmqY9v-GMHb5YqyFaYC6cg.text: Well nothing takes you back to Spain like getting on an aeroplane and flying there when the finances are right. But here in Phoenix, if you can settle for watered down sangria for $8 a glass, no bullfight, and no cigarette smoke then dining at Tapas Papa Frita is recommended. On weekends you can enjoy entertainment with dinner.  The menu is large and heavy and of a reddish background color, so it was a bit annoying to read through. But of course being from the Yelp community I pre-read it online and already had an idea of what I would get. Go figure I was asking everybody else if they were ready to order yet.  Other reviewers have complained about the lack of service. That wasn't my experience. In fact I feel like we were over served. I had to give our waitress the evil eye for popping over every two seconds while we perused the menu. And at meals end she insisted on taking our leftovers to wrap them herself instead of bringing containers to the table.  There were several selections of vegetarian tapas. Few were vegan, some prepared with cheese or type of crema, one had ham (which I'm unsure why it would be listed in the vegetable section).   Having tapas is kind of like building your own tasting menu, and we didn't hold back. Here are the uniquely tasty morsels we tried.   1. Pastel a la Porrusalda: Leek tart in a pastry - 6.50 Liked it, but the dough was a bit chewy  2. Champinones al Jerez: Braised mushrooms with garlic and sherry - 6.50 Liked it, but not too flavorful  3. Pimientos a la Riojana: roasted peppers with olive oil - 7.50 Liked.  4. Patatas Bravas: Spicy red potato wedges - 4.95  Liked them, but they had crema on top and were not spicy at all.  5. Tortilla de Patatas: Spanish potato pie - 4.50 Liked, but it was dry.  6. Escalivalda: Peppers, onions, eggplant, tomatoes, garlic over bread - 7.00  The veggies were good, but had a tangy taste. Did not like the bread, it was hard and not garlicky.  7. Cabrales con Menbrillo: Cabrales cheese with quince - 9.00 So-so  8. Setas con Queso De Cabra: Stuffed portabello with goat cheese - 9.00 Recommended by the waitress. Liked it, but it was too small.  I expected a burger sized mushroom, but it was about a third of what I expected.  9. Pollo al Ajillo: roasted chicken thigh in lemon garlic - 7.00  Having gone through the basket of white bread rolls and aioli and all these tapas, we were getting full. But entrees were coming.   1. Pollo con Jamon: Ham and cheese wrapped chicken breast with capers, and guindilla sauce - 16.00  2. Paella de Vegetales: Seasonal garden vegetables with saffron rice - 16.95   Although the paella was tasty I would not order it again. As a rice dish with cooked veggies the whole thing just had a mushy consistency to me. One spoonful was more than enough.  And now for the sweetest ending. No spanish dinner is complete without some churros. But share one dessert? Not at my table! So we also ordered the Pastel de Pan: banana and apple bread pudding with ice cream - 6.00   There's no point in saying another word about the bread pudding. If you like bread pudding then try it.   Cut to the churros. Oh dessert heaven...the churros! Churrrrrrrrros. I felt like dancing around the restaurant stomping my heels like a flamenco dancer and instead of clacking castanets, I would have churros on my fingers.   Churros con Chocolate - 7.00 Served warm, stuffed with hazelnut/caramel filling (??) and with a side of chocolate.  Unfortunately they were coated in a lot of unnecessary sugar, but delicious just the same.

zGaPHP5viYEZ0X9YFQc75g.text: Excellent food, excellent service. A little on the expensive side, but well worth the cost. The paella Valenciana was spot on and the sangria was perfect. The rabbit tapa was a tad small and bone riddled, but had great flavour and the ox tail was bold and fell right off the bone!

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The paella Valenciana.
Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The sangria was excellent

8QroIMBJDPAqBbQTZfLS-A.text: This place is one of my go tos. That being said it's a 4 because it's kinda inconsistent. Some of the tapas are great and some meh. Good ambience especially along the canal outside with fire. The servers all have a lot of personality. It feels like a little slice of Spain here.

Xu7XzTtJoozlDydEqkP_kQ.text: Cool experience the host is really nice and the place is inviting, the waiter service every time we go is never good. The dancing and singing is awesome and most of the food options are good . We had a older woman waiter that told us the entree was two pieces of meat and it was really four  and she was rude and no where to be found at times , she was rude when she gave us the bill , the waiters aren't very friendly..

lKtSl4Lt5yuDmbUghJCTeQ.text: My brother is a huge fan of this place, so he's the one that introduced us here.  So far, we've been to this restaurant 2 times.. both for celebratory events (birthdays).  There are a ton of reviews, so I'm going to make it short and sweet: - food not on the HH menu is expensive and, for what I've tasted (which was actually quite a lot of dishes), there were only a few that deserved that pricing (one I recall was the lamb chops)... and if I don't remember the food I had, it's cuz I didn't find it that memorable. - it is super trendy and thus crowded and you *need* a reservation  This is NOT how I enjoyed having tapas in Spain... things were casual, affordable, simple but tasty, not pompous nor snobbish.  That is the kind of tapas place I would like to go to (and was expecting my first time here).  Short story: not really my kind of place... food wasn't memorable enough (nor was the ambiance enjoyable enough) for my taste.. wasn't worth the money we blew eating here... sorry, bro....

TVWJnuFxYJWQjvsc3sijQQ.text: we went a little overboard here but it was worth it. We ordered so many small plates because we wanted to try so many different things. I mainly stuck with the vegetable plates and the boyfriend went for the meats. I was over all pretty happy with everything i ordered.. the garbanzo bean spinach dip was my absolute favorite but besides that nothing really knocked my socks off. My boyfriend was very happy with his dishes so it was money well spent. Our server was very informational and super helpful and took great care of us. Small plates are the way to go if you're looking to share and get a diverse amount of dishes.  Live music.. pretty interior and exterior views.

e0vQ2BkbWiXC9BRsfSFZGA.text: I adore Tapas Papas Frita! It is located right on the Scottsdale Waterfront with wonderful indoor and outdoor seating. I went on a Saturday night because I wanted to take in the live flamenco music and dance, which was definitely worth the wait and crowd. I recommend making a reservation to ensure a saved table.   Overall, I had a great experience. Our service was friendly and available. The food was delicious. Our table split two appetizers: crab and squid. I ordered the black rice and squid paella which I HIGHLY recommend. For dessert, I had a traditional flan -- it was a perfect way to complete the evening.   Also, I suggest the happy hour during the week... there are great deals for white and tapas!

qlbmXxvFdw6VlWQ574uYeA.text: Amazing food and service.  Eduardo was an exceptional waiter also Marcos the hostess/runner talked us into a wonderful evening. Great atmosphere we will definitely be back!!  Love this place!!  Thank you for a wonderful dinner.  Lori Agresta.

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Amazing evening!!

HCHsDoToH3HV8fsj7ULJYg.text: The food: Awesome. I recommend the Oxtail appetizer and the steak is also amazing. The atmosphere: As close to Spain as you're going to get in Scottsdale.  The service: Our waiter was very friendly, attentive, and had good recommendations.

6CktkznLXB9QXAI2V4d98A.text: This is probably the best location for a restaurant in Scottsdale. On one side, there's the waterfront, and the other overlooks a lovely little park with its own fountain.  Inside, it's just as attractive. Tables for two are cozy but not overly small and the restaurant accommodates large groups as well.  We went on a Saturday night and loved the band and dancer. They alone were the best part of the meal, closely followed by attentive wait staff.  As for the food, I'm a bit puzzled. I don't have another tapas experience to compare this to but I like the concept. It's sort of like dim sum minus the little carts going around that let you see the offerings. Or closer to home, the kind of tasting experience you get at food festivals like the one in Scottsdale. Except, of course, you can't see what you're ordering.  We tried a cheese plate--Manchega, which was nice--two seafood dishes, and Spanish meatballs. One of the seafood dishes sounded great--crabmeat-stuffed peppers--and it was very pretty but frankly, the crabmeat was underwhelming. Not bad, just nothing to get excited over.  The clams were in a tasty broth and the meatballs came in an tangy sauce. But honestly, the only thing that really wowed us was the sauce served with the bread, a kind of tzatziki.  I hope the veal and shrimp are the menu standouts but we'd made these at home the night before so we didn't try them. Maybe we should have.  Other Yelpers mentioned watered-down sangria. Mine was definitely was. But then, I've only had sangria at other people's homes. Maybe my friends make it too strong? Maybe Spanish cuisine is meant to be subtle? My overall impression from Tapas Papa Frita is underwhelming.  I can't say enough good things about the experience there, though. It was definitely a fun night. If I go back, I'd like to get there early enough to sit at the bar for a direct view of the dancer, who was wonderful!

C33InZLT2DCQc6lKb3nEgA.text: Love this place. Yumi La Rosa and her group does beautiful artful flamenco on the small stage near the bar Friday and Saturday evenings. Not to be missed!!! The tapas is always very good. The bartender suggested the seafood and I wasn't disappointed. A cool glass of Pino Grigio was perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yumi La Rosa was terrific! Dont miss the show!!!!!

HfIfQvQ-mXDPL6GLoRsKnQ.text: This is a great place to take your significant other on a date due to the ambiance of the place. I would recommend going on Friday or Saturday to see the flamenco  dancers from 7:30-10:00pm. As for food I would start with the Tortilla de Patatas or the Pastel a la Porrusalda as an appetizer and of course a paella for the main course.

gnsIPFRY0YS1XYLuUfLJFQ.text: I am providing two stars because I liked the service. I came here for Restaurant Week, drawn by the blend of flavors. I enjoyed the ambiance within the restaurant and the service. While the tapas, serving as somewhat of an appetizer was quite appealing, I was mostly looking forward to the main entree which was salmon with apple bacon and a spicy mango agave coulis with saffron rice. The presentation seemed to promise a burst of flavor, but what I received was lackluster--not only was the saffron rice gummy and mushy and overcooked (and kind of an insult to such a high quality ingredient!), my salmon was overcooked to the point of having no flavor, it was tough and chewy to eat. The mangos, while offering freshness, I didn't get any taste of spices whatsoever. The dish was not "spicy" as the description said. There was no depth or various note of any kind but rather bland and unappealing. I didn't taste the agave, which is thought of being sweet like honey. There was no note in this dish and I was sorely disappointed and was expecting a lot more especially for paying $44 which seemed a bit much for what I received. The dessert was also a bit of a miss. You can't go wrong with churros. The churros, by themselves, were delicious but the chocolate dipping sauce tasted like a bar of unsweetened chocolate. I've had dark chocolate before, but this was not smooth but rather very bitter and unpleasant so I avoided dipping the churros in after that. The only real thing I liked about my evening was the goat cheese bacon-wrapped date.

NNP3zKFSL5lXV_coLj8tIQ.text: Came here for restaurant week by recommendation of a friend. The food was very tasty, the location was perfect for a nice walk after dinner, and Denzel took really good care of us. We went for the osso bucco and it was good. I did not like the rice much but everything else was delicious.

FMvevffhNbn3lwrfkyX3-w.text: We picked Tapas Papa Frita from the Restaurant Week website for our anniversary dinner on a Saturday. I was hoping for a romantic spot on the patio since it was nice outside and we'd beat the crowd with our 5:30pm reservation. Inside the restaurant was pretty bare so unfortunately we were given an awkward table in the back, facing the bar and near the kitchen...probably to give the inside servers something to do...even though I'd put "Anniversary Dinner :)" on our OpenTable reservation/note to the restaurant. I wouldn't have minded this so much since we were isolated from everyone else, but another couple was seated directly behind us, about 3 feet away so it was just plain awkward.   Our server Vincent was actually pretty amazing. My water was never empty and he even went out of his way to ask the chef if we could order an item from the Restaurant Week menu (since we'd strayed onto the regular menu for the paella). We ordered two items from the tapas menu - crab stuffed peppers and the patatas w/ aioli, plus the bacon wrapped dates (RW menu item), and all three were awesome. I ordered the steak + bleu cheese and my SO ordered the diablo paella. The steak was cooked perfectly but the paella was lacking some serious spice considering the title, albeit delicious and well seasoned. I also ordered the sangria, which I thought was great (and even ate the fruit). Overall we left the restaurant stuffed and pleased with our anniversary date location decision.   And now my reasoning for the poor rating. Several hours after leaving TPF I started to get a stomach ache that, at first, felt like my stomach just wasn't agreeing with all of that food I ate, but then turned into something sinister. I'll spare you the gory details but will say that this was definitely food poisoning. Fever, nausea, the whole nine yards. I'm not sure what exactly it was - my mom blames the sangria fruit - but needless to say I don't plan on eating steak, bleu cheese, or any of the items we ordered that night anytime soon.

YySGEeJtMAve1smLpSiBdA.text: Well...this has been one of the worst dining experiences I have had in a while..our server was rude and dismissive our entire meal, which we were probably lucky to get in the first place judging by all the tables around us which are still waiting for their food or drinks. We have been here two hours and I have not seen a manager or had anyone stop by to apologize for all the delays and bad service. We sat with dirty dishes for 45 minutes before we cleared our own plates from the table and had to flag down the waiter anytime we needed anything otherwise. Each time we were able to speak to him was clearly an inconvenience. The food was good, but given price the poor service it is not somewhere I would recommend to anyone or return myself.

F1wXvbbOgqPRObp43jLtRg.text: My first time at Tapas this evening and I LOVED it! It had been my first time eating Spanish food.  I got risky and tried the  "Conejo Romescu" ~ Rabbit stew with bread sauce, it was awesome!  The flavor was sooooo good. I think the rabbit taste between a turkey and chicken.  So that was my tapas plate. Then for the main dish, I got the "De Pollo" ` Saffron rice with chicken, sausage, tomatoes, onions, garlic, roasted peppers and peas. Very good, I couldn't even finish my food! But I did save a bit of room for desert...I choose the "Pastel de Pan" ~ Banana & Apple Bread Pudding...mmmmm good.  Another person in my party got the Churros con Chocolate....WOW the chocolate was to die for! Overall, my waiter was great, he gave us recommendations on what to order, and I was glad to see the kitchen from where  I was sitting at and I would definitely go back there to try more new dishes.

Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pastel de Pan ~ Banana &amp; Apple Bread Pudding
Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Paella Diablo 5  ~ Shrimp Paella with, Jalapeno, chile de arbol, chipotle, banana pepper, cayenne (very hot)

UWxA_OKjdeybjwLGnedRDA.text: Came here for drinks before dinner since I heard about the Flamenco show...sit at the bar, order appetizers and just watch the performance (Fri and Sat 7-9 pm). Such a fun spot and I wish we stayed longer but we had dinner reservations elsewhere that I wanted to check out.  Spain in Scottsdale experience all the way!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Weekends from 7-9
Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Flamenco w/dinner!

Tk5b88li7JCvS-mtswxYtQ.text: This was my first time at a Spanish restaurant and this place exceeded my expectations. Went on a Saturday evening with my friends and everyone loved it. We ordered several Tapas and Paellas and the food was awesome. Taking away one point because of the scarcity of the staffs. Our waiter was serving several tables so it was taking quiet a while to get his attention. Other than that we had a blast.

BAP75DRymThEJ2w27Ww8ZA.text: Always love going to Tapas Pap Frita- excellent food, wonderful service, great Happy Hour but all the tapas are affordable and delicious.

yq5tJRQiaAuLCAIFxLIX4A.text: Tapas Papa Frita was just very average. The service was fine. Nothing really to complain about, but nothing was outstanding. The food is just okay. Their menu is way too large and I think that prevents them from being really great. I had the oxtail, stuffed peppers and I also got the paella despite all the complaints here and I have to agree with others I've read. It was oddly watery and not crispy on the bottom as I would expect.   The people there were very nice, but unless there's an uptick in the quality of food, I doubt I'll come back. It wasn't bad, but there's too many good options nearby to not be great.

-bi9j30H3d46SBFayCWWvQ.text: Great service, awesome atmosphere. We sat outside by the fire and it was really nice. We could see all the lights on the waterfront. They give you bread to start with, the dip they give you with the bread is soooo good. A perfectly creamy garlic sauce. Next we got patatas bravas, they were really good. The ones at the bottom got pretty soggy, but still tasty. I was happy to see some vegetarian options that looked really good. I had never had paella before, so I got the paella de vegetales. It was really good. And HUGE. I almost never bring leftovers home and I got to bring half my meal home. Only complaint was that it was a little too salty. Still good though. It was a pricey meal but not bad for the quality and portion you're getting.

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bread!
Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Patatas bravas
Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Paella de vegetales

DhG1vU1Tkf0qljreiZx13w.text: Fantastic restaurant, outstanding food and service. I celebrated my 50th b'day recently and was able to make party arrangements directly with the Chef and Owner, Joseph. What a memorable night. The Flamenco and Cuban night offerings complete the unique experience you expect at this awesome place. Thank you Joseph and all your stuff, we'll see you soon. Alin & Alexandra

qvBDKd7lkpdbRu-v89fA4w.text: The location is so beautiful, the restaurant is well designed and so nice. Good size bar and lots of outside seating. The food is absolutely incredible, I love the tapas such a great selection. It reminds me of being back in Spain. I highly recommend coming and trying a variety of tapas. The sangrias are awesome they have red, white and champagne sangria. You can't go wrong with anything in this place.

Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Churros with chocolate sauce

bbspnP_Wc4GZaYK1xtS9SQ.text: Tapas are really good.  They lack having a gluten free menu or designations.  Live music some nights

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

EZEUqA5qsU115ikTkLm_7g.text: Well, I was hopeful. The staff was super nice, hence the three stars. The food-eh. The situation is cool, people watching rocks from the patio, all the idiots on their Segway and arguing tourists made it better. They had some cool Spanish beer that I liked. But the food was salty and tasted like rice a roni. I am not kidding. The paella was really below par. And was not cheap. It was  a bummer. Hope you do better.

bcDqb_3nFbr9cu2XUJRSCQ.text: Delicious good great service!!! Wonderful like atmosphere. We sat outside and enjoyed a wonderful Arizona night!

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Absolutely delicious!! .  My husband hasn&#39;t ever had Spanish tapas and I&#39;m so glad his first experience was great!!

APqfI-v0LaYYLqGRu-3K6w.text: It kills to have to give a 2. Have been here many times before and the food was incredible. Tonight arrived earlier than normal. Paella was scorched and burnt to bottom of pan. Not the fine crunch normal. Waiter water and drinks were few and far between.    Will we be back absolutely. Just remember to await the head chef to arrive to orchestra the kitchen.   Ambiance and Music incredible.    A one of disappointment I am trusting.   Cheers

P0-0WZhNkB_JfURtPHzSFA.text: Wow. I was almost not going to try this place due to the Yelp reviews... I'm so glad I did! One of the best tapas place I've been to. I took my friend here for her birthday the atmosphere was fantastic with the flamenco dancers and being right by the waterway. Our server Lauren, was very attentive and not trying to oversell us on anything. We had the pitcher of sangria which was strong and not too sweet, just how I like it. They had an abundance of tapas to choose from. The bread they give you to start off with the garlic aioli is so delicious(holy garlic breath, but worth it). We ordered the albondigas, egg dipped cod, potatoes with aioli, garlic shrimp,mussels with garlic sauce and the beef tenderloin. The only tapas I'd suggest skipping is the beef tenderloin, it was nothing to write home about. Overall a fabulous experience and I'd recommend to anyone in the area.

AkTBgpPPi5OUJ6JWSbeZ2Q.text: This review is long overdue.  I just Love Love Love this place.  Every time I have dinned here, it has been a different experience.  The first time, I ate here, I admitted to our server that I wasn't very familiar with the cuisine and they prepared a diverse assortment of tapas paired with bottles of wine for the table.  Needless to say, every time since, I allow them to do it again and again for me.  Even though its a little pricy by the end of the night, I can not say enough good things about this restaurant.  It is great for date night and especially out on the patio when the weather is right.  A definite must dine at establishment in old town scottsdale.

6UsFhNRJrpt7LEuEjmi0YA.text: Our food was delicious but the service needs a serious change and was trash. Our server was very very nice but at the end of the day as soon as we walked in at 10:20 (restaurant closes at 11:00pm) they were even hesitant to seat us. They scrambled around and asked if we had a reservation which we did, who knows what would've happened if we didn't. As soon as we sat down, our server told us the kitchen was about to close -- 40 minutes before the restaurant closes! -- Anyways, we ordered our food and in anticipation of the kitchen closing we ordered out desert at the same time. When our food arrived, our tapas came out and guess what else came out? Our dessert. It sat at the corner of our table while we ate dinner and until we were ready for it. They pretty much rushed us out of the restaurant.   With the location in combination with the ambiance, I would've never expected this restaurants service to be as bad as it was on a Saturday night. The kitchen was "closing" 40 minutes before the restaurant did, the food runners literally packed all our food on the table at the same time so we could finish and leave. On top of that, all the servers were sitting by the bar on their phones basically waiting for us and the two other families next to us to finish and leave so they could go home. That's not how good quality restaurants should be!

j6KLql1IikTG9yrZMtaomw.text: We had a great time visiting this location and enjoyed the sangria tapas and seafood. Very beautiful

G632ArfFCgGCenwV1buU8A.text: Food was so tasty!  And our server was on top of it.  We really enjoyed the live entertainment look forward to going back and trying other items.

QdsF4yE0di8wLG7tk6GuuA.text: If you are looking for a unique experience to bring your friends and family, this is the place to come to. We absolutely love coming here, the food is amazing, the atmosphere is fun and the Flamenco dancer is so talented. We came here tonight to celebrate our son's birthday and Chef Joseph did not disappoint. Fantastic simply fantastic!!!!!

hRfkWTu_cRB5chmXK_VAEw.text: Ambiance-Excellent... Live Cuban/Caribbean Music - Excellent...  Food (Paella, Sangria and Mixed Tapas) - FANTASTIC.!.! Service - Very Good... Can't go wrong...  Price - Reasonable for all of the above.  $$$

BOQtiHZvJys19yvAFjP_IQ.text: Went there for tapas and sat at the bar. Tapas were mediocre. I tried four items and didn't like any of them. It was my boyfriends first time trying Spanish tapas and I was quite disappointed he didn't experience something decent and authentic. Service was ok tho. The highlight of the night was the flamenco show. We didn't even know about it and realized we were sitting right in front of the stage, we got lucky! The show was amazing, amazing guitar and amazing dancers! Made it worth it. The food? Meh!

BeiE7jOILbCPW1t53zHNrw.text: What an awesome place to have a lasting experience! The outdoors seating, the canal, the wonderful live music, cold drinks and tasty food. You can't ask for much more. This place has it all, and the servers make sure to show pride in their culture to deliver an outstanding experience. 10/10

C5CEbQ2tlhtTJyyz6w-8ig.text: Fun place to visit on a nice weather Friday night. Beautiful patio and Flamenco dancing.  Food is good and tons of things to try. Also extensive wine list for all prices.  Service was quite slow but not too bad.

mubNa-NyJlzvu7Jz-qM-hA.text: We went for a special occasion and special it was! The bartender while we waited was able to concoct a complex mixed drink that most folks have never heard of before.  We also had a small pitcher of sangria delivered to the table.  We were seated and had an assortment of tapas--everything was awesome.  Carlos, the flamigo dancer, is world class.  I have a video and picture of my food to share - because words can't describe the experience that well.  Great evening, great entertainment, great service and great ambience!

Xx0mNoK1ZybLNP50r5u1vw.text: We had reservations as a part of Arizona restaurant week.  We went into it looking forward to trying a new tapas experience in AZ.  We were huge fans of the late Sol Y Sambra.    Everything was going well, helpful server made suggestions that we chose to follow and ordered one additional tapas to try as well.  When the tapas course arrived I had to ask what one of them was.  The server had mis-heard what I wanted and brought the wrong dish.  OK, he picked the dish up and headed back to the kitchen after saying he thought we had asked for that particular dish.  In a minute the manager appeared at the table next to us with that exact same dish telling the table that there had been a mix up and here is an extra tapas for them to enjoy - HUH?    At no point was it mentioned that the dish had already been served to another table.  We were not offered the dish to try even though it was a mistake nor were we offered any apology or additional dishes for the mistake.  When the incident was addressed to the manager to express the upset, he made no attempt to right the wrong or address the problem.  When the correct tapas finally arrived at the table, it looked like a can of tomato soup dumped over tomatoes - that was my last straw.  The server came over and I let him know that we were not interested in continuing the meal and wanted to leave.  He said he would let the manager know and the manager made no attempt to come speak with me at our table.  They offered to comp the meal if we wanted to stay or we could go.  For the first time in my life I opted to leave.  Inexcusably poor customer service, questionable sanitary food practices and mediocre food from the one dish I tasted.  I would not recommend to anyone.

_GbNOc8E8i451vtHqIlk-A.text: ambiance: beautiful moorish archways inside, gorgeous al fresco dining, they had a guitarist there who was great, on saturdays they have flamenco performances (i was there on a sunday) service: ok, they had a lot of new servers, they are dressed like they are about to run with the bulls! I gave them 2 stars for ambiance  If you like their food, then you don't know what authentic yummy tapas are supposed to taste like  but when i go out to eat tapas, I expect something better than my home cooking. I knew after I looked at their extensive menu that they food would be so-so, reheated, or something like that. How could restaurant have all those choices, with foods that require lengthy preparation, and the restaurant was only 1/4 full on a sunday.  Highlights: free bread: pan de sal, rolls served with garlic sauce (or what they call aioli). they garlic sauce was yum....but when the dishes started to come out...i was disappointed...they all had the same garlic aoili  I typically order the following tapas at each tapas restaurant I try out to see how each one compares to each other, i've toured spain and ate a tons of tapas places so I know how it should taste:  1) Tortilla espanola 2) Patatas Bravas 3) Pan tomate  4) Paella Valenciana 5) Red Sangria 6) Croquettas (if they are on the menu, very few restaurants serve these) 7) Sepia(cuttlefish)/Calamares (squid)/ or Pulpo (octopus) a la Plancha  I didn't end up ordering the pan tomate or the tortilla espanola this time. They didn't have a "---" a la plancha on the menu either.. Duh, becuase in order to serve seafood a la plancha it has to be fresh and everything here tasted reheated.  We ordered:  1) patatas bravas: tasted/looked like KFC potato wedges with La Tapatia sauce.  Don't get me wrong, they still tasted decent but they were not authentic 2) fried artichoke with aoili: luke warm brined artichoke with beer batter  lying in a puddle of the garlic aoili suace (yes, the same one that was served with bread) 3) escargot: basically your average canned escargot in garlic/parsley sauce with drizzles of garlic aoili suace (yes, the same one served with the bread), this tasted good, but when does escargot in garlic butter not tasted good? 4) Paella Valenciana: they did not use paella rice, they had too much green bell pepper saute on it, the chorizo? i thought it was cut up vienna sausage at first, but it was chorizo, just in miniature form, they should have just minced it, the rice was more like a stew because there was tons of broth left in the pan, so no burnt soccarrat at the bottom to enjoy, you could tell the rice was blanced earlier and then tossed together with the ingredients in a pot then placed in the paella pan for service...don't bother ordering this if you like paella...it will just piss you off..and where was the saffron essence? 5) ham & cheese croquettas: 3 luke warm croquettas lying in a puddle of the garlic aoili suaces, again: they inside should melt out of the crispy breading, but because it wasnt' hot enough or because the filling was made with too much flour, it didn't  Definitely DO NOT ORDER:  Sauteed mushrooms: it only took them 3 min to bring it out after we ordered them, they were soooo grey and nasty.  I couldn't eat another bite! they were only warmed through...ugh yuck!  Stuffed squid braised with squid ink: i've had a version of this tapa several times so I know this stuff had to be good. Wrong.  The squid stuffing was luke warm in the middle. The ink sauce was missing something, it was heavily diluted with the flavor of chicken bouillion cube broth.

9i7c-TauQwOGxzvC5ecDuQ.text: So I had my first experience with Tapas last night. Our first blunder was with the host. We didn't have reservations and they gave us this look, like we didn't belong. Bad first impression I thought and I was like well we will just sit at the bar then, which I find better anyways, and they complied. The bartender was very informative with the menu and gave us some suggestions, so he made up for the host. After a round of drinks our food arrived and the presentations was very aesthetically appealing. After trying a single bite of each dish, all I have to say is that the food was fantastic!! A friend and myself went here with no expectations and we were delightfully pleased on the type of meal in which we received. We split 4 dishes. We had a shrimp dish, a lamb, a chicken, and a squid stuffed with cuddle fish. The food was divine.  My only real complaint about that place is how loud it is. They have a live band. I'm not sure if it's every night or only on the weekends. Though the band was exceptionally good and they had a dancer it was so friggin loud. My friend and I were pretty much screaming at each other the entire night and we were literally right next to each other sitting at the bar. That's why I will give this place a 4 stars instead of 5. I will definitely be back though. Maybe for lunch instead of dinner though.

DEqT-rV-OPwbil5UwdfbEQ.text: Don't understand the negative reviews. Food was great, service excellent and ambiance fantastic. A little pricey but well worth it. Our visitors loved this place.

FzfWh2sMAPIze5m8DDPB_g.text: Let me start by saying that I was very excited thinking about a new Spanish restaurant in town as they are few and far between around here. Having traveled quite a bit in Spain we are huge fans of tapas and paella. So we went to Tapas Papa Frita with great anticipation for a delicious meal. I am sad to say that this restaurant was a complete letdown for a variety of reasons.   The restaurant itself is absolutely lovely. I loved the way the place was decorated with representation of Joan Miro's work, since he is one of my all time favorite artists. The restaurant presents itself very nicely.   We decided to try this restaurant also because their website advertised "During the month of August...everything on the menu will be buy one and receive the second one at no charge" for happy hour 5-7pm. Our interpretation of this was that you could buy one item and choose another item for free. The reality was that it was buy one item and get a double portion. This was not clearly worded on their website.   We sat at the bar and were immediately met with a pretentious attitude form the bar tender which is typical, but unfortunate, in many Scottsdale restaurants. He became more rude when he found out we did not want to order drinks.  This makes no sense to me because the meals cost quite a bit more than drinks would have so it's not like his tip would have suffered. After that he left us to sit for a very long time before taking our order. So long in fact that the manager had to come around to see why our order hadn't been taken. The bartender finally came around after a prompting from his manager and took our order.   We ordered Txipirones en su Pinto (stuffed squid) and Alcachofa a la Romana (fried artichokes) for our tapas. For dinner we ordered the Paella Valenciana for our entree, to be shared since it was double portion. The fried artichokes arrived on the cool side and the batter was soggy. As I pulled the batter away from one of the artichokes I could taste that it was a marinated artichoke, which was clearly canned or jarred. The appetizer was soggy and unappealing. The stuffed squid arrived and for a "double portion" as the happy hour special stated, we received 3 squid. My question is what is the full sized portion? 1.5 squid? The squid was tasty, it was served in what I'm assuming was a blank ink sauce with a spicy tomato sauce on the side. This was the only redeemable part of our meal, it really was quite good. The bread and aioli that was served before the meal was also very good.   On to the entree, our "double portion" of the Paella Valenciana. I should say that we've eaten enough tapas and paella in Spain to where we have a very good idea what to expect from these classic dishes. This was not authentic Spanish paella. First it's impossible that it be truly authentic since it came out in about 15 minutes, traditional paella takes at least 45 minutes to prepare. It was served in a cast iron skillet but it did not have that chewy, crunchy texture that paella has when it's actually finished in the oven. The rice was on the firmer side when it should be mushy and there was a flavorless watery broth whereas True paella should be rich with saffron flavor and the rice should have absorbed any liquid that it was cooked in. The sausage that it was prepared with was tasty but incredibly salty. The chicken was dark meat which I found disappointing. The shellfish was fine, albeit the shrimp were overcooked. Overall I am very sad to say that it was a terrible dish of paella, it was not authentic and not even really worth eating which is why we left a third of it behind.   Lastly, the restaurant was very warm and the bathrooms appeared to have no air conditioning or the vents were closed. It was 110 degrees today and they had 2 doors right by the bar where we were sitting propped wide open. I understand that it's a new restaurant and they wanted passersby to know that they were open; however, in this day of eco-consciousness, I found this to be an unconscionable waste of energy. Moreover it made the restaurant very warm and uncomfortable. So in my opinion the doors being open resulted in a lose lose situation.   Thankfully our bill was low due to the "double portion" special because I would have been incredibly disgruntled had we paid full price for bad food and bad service. I think Tapas Papa Frita has a nice concept, but they are definitely not ready for prime time.  I can tolerate a pretentious Scottsdale restaurant when the food is dynamite, but this is not the case at Tapas Papa Frita. It's both pretentious and serves bad food. It's a pity because the place is lovely. I hope they pull it together so they can stay in business, but we will not be returning here.  PS* patxi g. who reviewed right below clearly works for this place as he reiterated the same bad wording of the happy hour special and the review seems overly phony.

UTCo0L2pyS6eBKWLctiYZA.text: Delicioso! I've travelled to Spain a few times and these tapas are by far the best tapas I've had outside of Espana. The food was great, the service was the perfect amount (not too much and not too little) and the ambiance was great! A few of the favorites from our party of 4's meals... Squid ink tapa, crab meat filled peppers, blue cheese steak, seafood bowl, rabbit, ox tail, and the flan! The best flan any of us had ever had.

eoV0sh8oSBMG0YzbNmJByw.text: Great food, the Head of the House is awkward, lacks passion and personality  I have been anxious for a Tapas place ever since Mexican Stand Still was to open in the space that is now Tapas Papa Frita.  So needless to say I was very optimistic when I saw a new restuarant was taking place of Mexican Standoff.   When we went there, we were in jeans and t-shirts which several other patrons were also wearing.  I don't know if it is because I have visible tattoos or if it is the lack of personality of the front of the house that caused the awkward interactions with him.  We walked in and he awkwardly shook our hands, like he was sizing us up??? It was very odd I didn't know how or what to make of it.  When we told him that there was just the two of us he asked if we wanted a table or sit at the bar.  When we said table, he said he liked starting people off at the bar.  When I asked why he couldn't really give me a reason.    After being sat I began worrying that this was an awful decision.  But then our amazing waiter, Timothy came out and was great! He made great recommendations and was friendly and very conversational.  We each ordered 4 tapas each out of which the oxtail, monk fish were the favorites.   The Head of the House walked around and it seemed almost like he was too shy or embarrassed as he approached tables around the restaurant.  When he came to the tables and asked us how we were doing not trying to engage us, it felt as I should have been at a Olive Garden. Engage me! Talk to me more about the food, the region the Chef is from.  I am at your new restaurant?  Cocktails:   On their website they list the sangrias, specialty cocktails and martinis when I asked about the cocktails and martinis they replied that they didn't have any but there was a full bar.  Not Timothy's fault, he is new and the restaurant so I will let that slip.     Ambiance - I would give it an A+ the views, decor spot on.  When you go into the men's restroom there are the beatnik paintings that were in Digestif by the bar...not sure what that has to do with Spain.   Overall, I would go back even with the head of house who is lacking personality and passion.  When I go back I will definitely ask to sit in Timothy's section!

ZwYOrTBI3HxtqQqbC-WvvQ.text: Great service; our server recommended several great dishes and was attentive but didn't hover.  Excellent wine list and all of our food was creative and flavorful!

LQyRzV16koQNXReG1olcng.text: Even though the food was quite good, I have to give this place a poor review because our overall experience was so unpleasant.  We went on a Thursday night when there was live music and flamenco dancing.  It was so loud - starting rather early at 7:30 p.m. - and completely interfered with our ability to have any conversation at our table.    I will say that the food was pretty good.  I'd characterize it as pretty traditional Spanish tapas.  Our table particularly enjoyed the oxtail, the crab stuffed piquillo peppers and the patatas bravas.  Great sauces on the oxtail, the snails and the shrimp.  I'd go back but only Monday through Wednesday when it would be quieter.

jRAjKtvSe-nLaxUfQ5EAMg.text: Goodness!  I'm not even sure where to begin!!  What a wonderful, delightful, evening our party of three enjoyed here!  From the moment we stepped through the door the magic began! We were a party of three  -   two males and one female with mixed ages  --  29 to 63 and I can honestly say Tapas appeals to all age groups.  It's both lively and elegant all at once with something for everyone.     The servers are all in white with red sashes around their waists  -  you feel as though you are in Spain and not Scottsdale!!  Not too mention how nice they all are. Our server was soooooo friendly and helpful in explaining everything and also with suggestions. You felt he was excited about being able to wait on YOU!!  Now that is not found in very many places.      We shared many different tapas between the three of us along with two dessests and I can tell you there was not a crumb left on any of the plates.  Plus the ROLLS  -- OMG  --  these are served first along with a dip.  They are made fresh everyday and are piping hot when they come to you.  They are to die for!!  OK  - we may be a little dramatic here because we happen to be three bread lovers but then again who better to critique a good piece of bread???  We had the sangria with lots ice and it was perfect with the meal on a hot summer night.       We are already planning our next trip back and taking some friends. Eventually we hope to try everything on the menu because every item listed sounded absolutely wonderful!!!  I cannot remember the "official" name of the one dessert we had but it was a different twist to Creme Brulee ---  I think it was a little caramel drizzled on the bottom,  topped by a scoop of vanilla ice cream with a bit of fresh fruit and then the traditional caramelized sugar on top  ---  I think I dreamed about it last night!!     Oh! Did I mention entertainment??  Incrediable Spanish Guitar players and Flamenco dancing. Between them and the menu nothing we ever had in Spain came close to our experience here last night  --  and this is a lot closer than traveling to Spain!!  Of couse it certainly helps that the owner and cooks ARE from Spain  --  doesn't get much more authentic than that!  No wonder the experience was wonderful.    Now here's a really big news flash  --  Tapas has only been open a few weeks and with the food and service you would have thought it was an establishment that had been around for years.  OH!!  Also the most beautiful patio by the canal  ---  what ambiance this place has - both inside AND out.   You will want to return again and again just to experience everything!    You did good Scottsdale  --  you have a GEM in your city with Tapas!  I have no doubt as more people discover this JEWEL there will be a wait list for tables. We were there on a Thurs. evening and it was busy.  I can hardly wait to show it off to out of town guests!

uK0eqyU0JXmnD5rD0PBN7Q.text: Went here after work with a group of my co-workers for Tapas and dessert, Delicious, good service, mostly yummy foods, live classical guitar set a great mood, I really enjoyed the ambiance with the lighting and the uniforms.

XVl9yJwAcMMBNFNFp5xZpQ.text: I acccidentally came across Tapas Papa Frita while walking around Old town with my girlfriend.  First the decor of the restaurant is beautiful making you feel like you're in the heart of Spain.  Flamenco dancing and Spanish guitar are authentic and LIVE!!  I thought the Tapas menu was extensive and the Gambas in Garlic and the Cabrales cheese were our favaorites but they all were excellent.  Our waiter was very helpful in suggesting wines and matching them with our Tapas selections and very attentive to our table.  The overall experience was fantastic...everyone around us was having fun and enyoying themselves.  The prices were VERY reasonable ($25 bottle of wine, $7 Tapas) and we were told their Happy Hour had everything on the menu, including drinks at 2 for 1 pricing.  We will go back, it's a real hidden gem...

vszUirJ7z3eHQPsoczmfaQ.text: Nice outdoor seating... very nice menu but at the end its almost the same items prepare differently ... The sangrias were good... the braised oxtail was very tasty... Overall nice place to hung out with friends... Not too sure about the servers uniforms? but there were very friendly and helpful explaining the menu...

GLOB-SsWYFbY1WAOUrKIFQ.text: Let's get this out of the way, the food is absolutely delicious. So why the two stars? Because the service was that bad! We were seated and about 10 minutes later a guy came by to take our drink order...the place was empty, there is no excuse for leaving someone waiting for a drink that long. He hastily delivered the drinks and bolted before I could say I was ready to order. 30 minutes later another waiter stopped by and asked "has anyone ever come by for you guys?" after I said no he then informed us that he was the only one willing to actually work tonight apparently. He was helpful in recommending some delicious tapas...but then he went over to the other staff and yelled "someone needs to figure out who is helping that table!" he never came back either....about 1 hour after arriving we finally got our meal. These were the smallest sized tapas I ever had. They were delicious but only a couple of bites for two people to share per plate. For the price I expected more. While leaving, I noticed a bunch of waiters sitting at a table on the patio messing around...ridiculous!

rb73MOgXrMvqu-yNwcIEPQ.text: The experience here was quite memorable that I would go back any day. Food was amazing ...sangria, tapas, paella and flan. We also got complimetary drink from the owner / head chef.

WlAWD6fULZnL1gMPYe1g8w.text: Randomly came upon this place with some friends and we totally fell in love!  Great energy inside and the food rocks!  We shared 3 tapas dishes and had cocktails and it was delicious...we were just looking for a snack :) Loved having the basque influence there with the kalimotxo, $18 was tough to shell out there for this but I hadn't had one in forever so I splurged...and it was exactly as I had hoped for.  Really cool restaurant, am looking forward to going back-I hope it sticks around because not many in this area have held up :)

llCqpsSrDwseQwTW3UALdQ.text: Went here last week with two other couples for the Happy Hour.  First, the facility is very attractive, with a rustic, old hacienda feeling.  Because it was a nice afternoon we sat on the patio.  We were fortunate to sit on the east side of the patio because it not only protected as from the afternoon sun but the north side looks over the muddy irrigation canal Scottsdale promotes as "The Waterfront" while the east side overlooks Stetson St.  Happy Hour has a limited selection of $3 tapas.  My wife and I shared the meatballs, chix w/ saffron rice, and the pork bruschetta.  We found them okay, nothing special, and a bit skimpy in portion size, except for the rice.  There were 3 small meatballs, which were good.  The pork consisted of 2 small pieces of meat on wooden skewers.  The chix w/saffron rice was the best of the three in terms of taste and quantity.  Of the other four people with us, three felt as we did that the food was okay while the fourth thought the food was horrible.  Happy Hour also has two-for-one sangria and house wines.  Opt for the wine because the sangria, while flavorful is a very small serving.  We would not make a special effort to return here for Happy Hour but if we were in the vicinity would probably stop.  Be very careful of the waiter pushing their paella specials!  Prices are $25 or $45 PER PERSON which is not emphasized by the waiter so you could get a big surprise.

vo2G6UifJl6A5pWfIcuV8Q.text: The happy hour here is awesome value for the money!    Dec 2012 features half off all tapas on the menu every day until 6p.m.  The three of us came here on a Sunday late afternoon, ordered a bunch of tapas and even had three boxes of leftovers to take home.  The Spaniard in our group liked the tapas a lot.  His only complaint was that the bread was very disapppinting - it didn't have the crispy crust that he is used to.  Both of the soups (tomato and red bean) we ordered were excellent.

lndDacJF9SRb9RbCmc4uvw.text: This place is ridiculously delicious.  I'd recommend it for larger dinner parties, only because it's nice to be able to sample the variety of dishes they have.  The menu is extensive.  We had six tapas dishes (my husband and me) and would've kept going except that since we were forced to eat slowly and in small portions, we actually did get full after a while.  We had spanish meatballs, an eggplant crab tart (our least favorite and we really liked it), an open faced empanada, a leek puff pastry (incredible) tenderloin skewers, and the ham and cheese croquettes.  Everything was delicious.  We wished that the plates had an equal number of items for splitting and sharing purposes.  Maybe the dishes could have had a little more food on them.  Overall, though, we truly enjoyed our experience.  Our server was great, the ambiance inside was very comfortable.  I'd definitely go back with a group.

pbiIXBVxaDddrgTRz3-xGQ.text: Seafood were not fresh at all, probably already past the date. Paella came with smelled chicken... Expensive, not clean, bad service.

qanhsNIRvmkH0I-iCnZYTg.text: Love this place. A while ago we went to dinner here and were not disappointed. The entertainment is top notch as is the food and service. You pay for it and it is totally worth it. This one is on my rotation.

k337ByOmO56an6gpJrFNGQ.text: Um.. how about no? Yeah, this place is a horrible disappointment. We were a group of 9 that came in to dine. I asked the server how their Sangria was. I swear he looked at me like I've asked him for his kidney. He replies "what do you want me to say? Of course its good". If I wanted standoffish, smart alecky replies to questions, I would've dined with my extended family. Anyway, the Sangria finally arrives and as I guessed, the quality of the drink was almost as terrible as the service. We weren't given menus for like 25 minutes after being seated. Good lord, how they are still in business is something that is beyond me.   We placed our orders for tapas after finally getting the menus. I ordered the special of the day, which was a ravioli in a pesto cream sauce, their version of a Spanish sausage and something else that was clearly so forgettable that I don't even recall what it was. The sausage had enough salt to season food for the state of Arizona. To make it worse, the texture was like rubber. Ugh.. I'm sure it managed to kill three fourth of my taste buds. Moving on to the ravioli with the so called pesto... I couldn't even get a hint of basil up in there. Not sure if there is an alternate definition of pesto in Spanish cuisine. This was however the most appetizing of everything I tasted that night. My friends ordered a wide variety of tapas and all of them were sub par to borderline unpleasant. The lamb chop my friend ordered was like jerky, the clams were overcooked, bacon wrapped dates was overdone too.. the list goes on. To make things worse, I had to pay $65 for the meal.. all this for a couple of drinks and three small tapas. The prices here are outrageous with dreadful food and service! The extra star is for the shrimp I tried from my friend's plate, and it wasn't the worst thing that night. Wouldn't return at any cost.

86g3MpbdcU0b2qp9gpU5zQ.text: Food and margaritas were great! It's a fun place to come with a group so everyone can try new things. The bread is amazing here. Tapas were a small and pricey, but definitely tasty. I was a also bummed they have no happy hour!

zH4CeKjmFLZ3qs5NtNIj1A.text: 4 stars for the food, +1 for the service.  Went here last may during an outing with the girls (we were shopping and randomly yelped here cuz the building looked fancy)  It wasn't too busy, and we we seated next to a window overlooking the plaza. They were very accomodating, rearranging tables and seats to seat all of us.   I ordered a lamb chop appetizer and a seafood Valencia paella. The lamb chop ($10?) was expensive for the size, but wow, it tasted great. My standard for lamb  was firm meat with a distinct "lamb smell". The one here was very juicy and soft. No tough fibers here!  When my paella came out, somehow the server mistook my request of "no onions" for "no onions and clams". I told the server, and a few minutes later, the cook himself came out and apologized for the error. He told me that he'll give me a bowl of clams instead of the 3-4 that's usually included in the pan. wow! thanks!  In the meantime, I ate a bit of the paella - the texture of the rice is very soft, like a risotto. the rice was soft, but not mushy. Peas, sausage and shrimp were nicely seasoned. Clams were nicely buttered with a hit of herbs.   Later on, the chef came out to check up on us again, and we reassured him the food was great (we also tried the banana pudding, the fried banana, the calamari, it was great)  This was the first time I tipped so much because of how amicable the staff was and I had such a great experience. If i'm ever in the area again, for sure I'll be coming back - you don't see places that specialize in paella in many places!

Pt-4KbpL2thxEeqQASdBow.text: I drove there with my friends and we ordered. Everything was fine until I found someone's hair in my dish. It was a long hair so we are sure it wasn't ours. I called the servant about it and he came and took the plate without apologizing as if I was done with my food. I did not have much time since I had a meeting and they take some time to cook their food. I was offered nothing in return and not even an apology. It was a bad experience. People working in "In-n-out" always apologize and fix their mistake right away. Go learn from a fast food restaurant since they know what they're doing.

cw5vLtdws2nUa-WPdPHU5A.text: This is probably my favorite restaurant in Scottsdale!  It has a great location (right on the canal) and I'd highly recommend grabbing one of the tables on the patio.  It's perfect for a romantic dinner over wine.  The atmosphere, and live music, makes it a super enjoyable place to grab some DELICIOUS tapas and Spanish wine.  Every tapa I've ordered has been amazingly good (and the bread that they bring to the table, with the dip, is to die for) and they have an awesome selection of reasonably priced wines.  Love love love this restaurant!

Gy4VtP3WYQ0TkMWLwowlHQ.text: I absolutely loved this place! We went on Valentine's Day, so there was a live band playing classic bossa nova and Spanish music. The food was so delicious, the plate of fish I ate was very filling and tasted wonderful. The service was great, and the ambience was so relaxing. Will definitely be going back!

lM-9SVNXVqWXKkKO0ALk9g.text: Excellent experience. Went with several families and had a great time. Live music and dancing was great. The kids loved the dancers. The food was phenomenal. We had just about everything.  Will definitely be back.

T7NAE7_-b_Qph9M_50KLNQ.text: Just had the paella lobster and shrimp with the chef's special. Amazing food and service.  Wonderful entertainment of live Latin  dancing & music to enhance the ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Paella lobster and shrimp wow

Ek9nuarQ9j6L7BXPXD90tQ.text: This would be the fifth best tapas bar I've ever been to if I had only ever been to five tapas bars. Man, I hate complaining on Yelp. But Tapas Papa Frita made me do it. I'll keep it short:   Food: Not particularly good. Nothing offensive, but all of the flavor was muddy and dull.   Drinks: Sangria came in a lowball glass (wut) and was a Oliver Twist level stingy serving. Like, dude. I did not pay $10 for 5 oz. of drink.   Service: The waiter was uncomfortably gushy, but after we order we didn't see him again. We were barreled at breakneck speed through our meal and then left to wait on the check for fifteen minutes while our waiter talked with his co-workers at the bar.   Also, the menu design was terrible. But also, they had mints on the way out which is why they got a 2 star instead of 1 star.

__Tip5npW2a33h9FF4re5g.text: Great atmosphere, love their live music nights, great food I have tried their chef special and it was amazing

Pd82XEAA42ZfcMZG06NRTA.text: We arrived just in time for the flamenco show... it was great but kind of short . Great place to enjoy tapas and drinks.

Z0P830Rf86AkN6EAr0MOvw.text: Paella was so so and the sangria needed a little more kick. The service, however, very friendly and attentive. Outdoor patio was pet friendly which came in handy since we brought our sweet little furry friend along.

M09_tvH4XxTYuHbYX6mwxw.text: Worst restaurant experience I've ever had. Went here for the first time with a large party. We told our server before ordering that we wanted to pay separately and when it came time for the check it took her half an hour to get us the bill. When she brought us the bill we were told if we wanted to pay separately it was going to "take her a while" because she couldn't figure it out. In desperation to get out of there we ended up having to just split the bill between us evenly which was not fair since not everyone got the same thing or drank as much. Neither the server or management was apologetic at all or willing to take anything off our $1500 bill to accommodate us because of such a poor experience. The food was also purely average. I don't recommend this to anyone.

t-JkqWFQHlHVVrj76hH4ww.text: Picturesque, authentic, excellent! This place takes you on a journey across the ocean without leaving your hometown. Jorge the server is incredibly knowledgeable and is full of excellent recommendations. And the chef? Actually from Spain! He takes you on a tour of his country without leaving your table! I can't stress enough how attentive and knowledgeable the staff are. My glasses were never empty, and my questions were never unanswered.  Seriously, you HAVE to try this place for yourself. You will not be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

v2pP0msnn-6I19IloSyqFQ.text: My friends and I love going outside of our comfort zone and try different ethnic food once in a while. We all planned a week ahead of time to eat at this local Spanish restaurant in Scottsdale. Personality, this was my first time trying Spanish food. I was very excited all week looking forward to come here. This general area is almost like a maze. It did take us a while to find out where it was located at. No matter if it was a good restaurant right? When we first arrived, I was impressed by their beautiful decorations and relaxing atmosphere in the patio area. I wanted to sit in the outside. But since it did rain here and there. It was best to sit in. That was when all hell broke loose.   Shortly after we seat down, the hostess gave us total of 4 menus. Two of which involved alcohol beverages. To avoid the clutter on the table since none of us were drinker, I politely asked her to take those two menus away. She looked annoyed and unhappy. Whatever. When our waiter arrived, he also started talking about drinks. I immediately told him the same thing again. Most high end restaurant would be smart enough to pick up all the wine glasses at this point in time, he didn't. We had to ask him instead. He responded by saying "I will in a minute" when we were the first table who arrived here. Hmm...r u too busy? He immediately rushed away from our table when we were all ready to order our drinks. This is definitely a bad start for a supposedly nice dining experience. While we were waiting for our drinks, I could hear someone in the kitchen yelling for another person for a minute straight. Really...? Staffs were all loud talking among each other as though we weren't even there. I definitely did not expect that from a nice restaurant in Scottsdale.   The food. Where should I begin? Every other clams that I chewed on have sand in it. My friend bite into one of the few and literally hurt her tooth. Unacceptable. I don't even want to bother with describing the taste of each individual dish. All I could tell u was their presentation was beautiful. But the food was tasteless. The Paella that I tried was covered with grease and the rice was soaked in too much juice. It might have been presented in a steel pan but trust me..it was precooked and reheated back up. I was extremely unsatisfied with the meals and the shitty service that we received. The waiter hardly gave us refill unless he was asked over and over again. He quickly rushed in and out of our tables even when it wasn't busy.   The only reason I still give it a 2 star is because their dessert was very delicious. Especially their homemade coconut ice cream that was served on a coconut. Their churros was served with chocolate syrups. That was heavenly delicious. I don't mind paying for a expensive meal when the food and service was great. But really...it was not worth it. I advice you to go somewhere else and save your money.

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Churros
Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Homemade coconut ice-cream in a coconut

c5GbCnLEfRVN88FhI9IQVQ.text: Reasonable food but atrocious service yet again.  We went for dinner the day after Thanksgiving and the place was not very packed.  We had dinner reservations some were able to get a table immediately upon arrival.  However, it took 20 minutes for a drink of water to arrive and another 30 minutes for a bread basket to show up. Food took an inordinate amount of time and they even came back to say that they ran out of hummus after a wait of 50 minutes!!  Unbelievably poor service.  I would be prepared to excuse the typical delays on a packed night but tis is the second time we visited the restaurant and the second time that their service failed.  Flamenco and Spanish guitar was great but we will not be going back again.  There are far better places in Scottsdale that are worth the big bucks that this place charges. What a disappointment.......again!

6kNX5yDWRZ4xryXOz54eTA.text: Reservation for Saturday and the place was packed!  We were seated promptly and then forgotten for awhile. Once we said something the owner Joseph made sure we were accommodated and provided us an overall great experience. Small plates of grilled calamari, tomato salad & bacon wrapped dates - yum!! Paella was also good - just good, not fabulous. Flamenco dancer with Spanish music in the background takes you away from the desert for an evening out. Very nice!!

cpA-he1zw5PbgpHjuRHGBg.text: Atmosphere: When you walk into this restaurant you will be welcomed by the sound of Flamenco music and colorful Spanish decor. From tile walls to dripping candle wax, there is always something unique and beautiful to look at.  Food: I always forget how delicious their food is. It's incredibly rich, the rice is amazing and I highly recommend just about everything on their menu. Make sure to pace yourself when ordering here.

k50v3r_syOKsoJqY6Fvt9Q.text: So we went here to celebrate someone's graduation. Honestly the food smelled pretty good and the place looked nice BUT apparently now in today's society and in this place, you have to be a certain age to order chicken tenders... you call this freedom?! Absolutely devastating. Truly disappointed. So parents. If your child is 11 years old and wants some good o' chicken tenders. This isn't the place for you. I can't believe this. I have to be under 10 years old to order chicken tenders with fries for about $7. I'm better off going to old reliable fast food. I bet they serve chicken tenders to people above 10 years old. This will not stand. The chicken was pretty good though. But was not worth the 1 hour and 30 minute wait and $13. I waited too long for my food. They don't even have lemonade. I don't see myself going here again. Too long of a wait. No chicken tenders if you're above 10 years old and no lemonade. Devastating. They don't even have a menu for the drinks. They tell you what they have but damn I order some sweet ice tea and that thing was as bitter as ripe lemon. They didn't even tell me they had pineapple juice. I would have gotten that but how was I supposed to know if they actually had pineapple juice? I found out when someone near us was served pineapple juice. And lastly one of my friends had to wait 1 hour for a glass of water. That's honestly pretty messed up. It's not like he asked once. He asked 5 damn times. I'm pretty sure it doesn't take that long to serve someone water. I have no idea how it is for other people but for us it was a bad experience.

cY94AKxZCmAUsKk56AWc3w.text: We came here visiting from Southern California and stumbled Upon this place when we heard the music playing on the patio. They had misters on the patio which kept it cool. We got a picture of the red sangria which was perfect and refreshing.     We ate the crab stuffed pepper which was excellent so we had two orders. Also we got the meatballs which the sauce was amazing but the meatballs were a little salty. We also ordered the artichoke and it was fried but nothing special. We will be returning.

UZyOyxm-s260V1d5743A1w.text: The ONLY Spanish tapas restaurant in Phoenix/Scottsdale. Beautiful to eat outside when it's not 100 plus degrees, with a beautiful view of the Riverwalk.   Saturday has flamenco dancing and music inside. Great entertainment.   Paella is delicious, although pricey. Tapas are delicious and authentic. Nice to share. Sangria, both red or white, is plentiful by the pitcher.   Fun place to eat if you'd like something different outside of a sports bar/hamburger joint in Phoenix.

vbJoXy21X5UcTsZwdmMKtg.text: Unfortunately have to knock off a couple stars after this past Valentine's Day. Perhaps our expectations were too high after our first experience a couple years ago, but I can't possibly leave this place at a 5 star review.  Unlike the previous Valentine's Day, we had a reservation this time so we ate earlier and it was very busy. We were unfortunately seated directly next to the stage with the live music, and they were decent enough but it was sooooooo loud! My boyfriend and I literally couldn't speak to each other while the music was playing because it was far too noisy, and it was near impossible to understand the waiter when he came by which was very frustrating. We considered asking for another table, but since the place was packed there was no chance of this happening.  We still tried to enjoy the night and ordered from the special Valentine's Day menu as before. The tapas were by far the highlight of the night, particularly the crab stuffed peppers, grilled shrimp, and oooh the bacon-wrapped dates stuffed with goat cheese... I still dream about those delicious little things.  Sadly though they didn't have the same choices for entrees as they did previously, which was a real bummer since the ones we had before were excellent. The only thing that really piqued our interest was the paella with clams, mussels, chicken, and sausage, so we got a large serving of that. It was very average, the flavor was decent but nothing really spectacular, and it was very watery as well. Really a disappointment compared to our previous Valentine's Day dinner here, and just didn't feel as special.  Perhaps we'll try again in the future or go on a normal day for their regular menu, but I still wish our most recent Valentine's Day experience could've matched our first.

ad_NyVZHnCLLL65Y4r2OGw.text: Awesome drinks, small plates and live band! We stopped in to have a cocktail before dinner and as usual, this place did not disappoint! My husband really enjoys the sangria and I had one (or two) lemon drop martinis!

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bar

twBQ8iYylk513OJ86XP8XQ.text: I give this spot 3 stars because of the flavor in the dishes. However the ambiance was lively and the staff were definitely on point checking on us and refilling water etc. The back room we were in got warm and it started getting uncomfortable mid meal. Mind you we were a large group (20+) so take that into consideration.  Now for the eats:   Starters:  Bread with a dipping garlic aioli ....we called it crack sauce because we couldn't stop eating it!  Campinones al jerez - mushrooms with garlic sauce. The dish ws as definitely served hot and you could taste the garlic. I'd say get some bread on the side to dip the sauce.  Pastel a la porrusalda - leek stuffed pastry...probably one of my favorite items.  Pollo al Ajillo - chicken thigh with a lemon and garlic sauce....the chicken was really tender, cooked well but the flavors didn't soak in well but when you did try the sauce it was delicious!  Other items:  Gambas al ajillo - shrimp was cooked well.and the sauce was tasty. Anotjer favorite of mine  Datiles con tocino - bacon wrapped dates....was alsona favorite of the table however some weren't fans of the "bbq" type sauce and some were.  Chuletilla de cordero - lamb chops...while it was flavorful it was slightly overcooked.  Dessert:  Manzana al horno - this one had all the right flavors to end the meal! The caramel drizzle was a bit sweet but with the ice cream it was tasty.  Churros con choclate- definitely a favorite of the room. The chocolate sauce that came for dipping was amazing.   I'll be back maybe a smaller group to try the items again :)

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Churros con choclate and manzana al horno

pReDzp-RaiAwToqycyq3VQ.text: I've been meaning to check out Tapas Papa Frita for years, but have always put it off because I was swayed by mediocre yelp reviews. Well, this restaurant week, the dude and I decided to finally pull the trigger and give it a try. We made our reservations and headed out to dinner on a shockingly chilly May night.   Walking up, we were excited to see that there was live music on the patio. However, since it was a little chilly, we opted for an indoor table. The interior was unexpectedly spacious for a waterfront restaurant, and had a nice ambience to it. All of the staff were friendly and attentive, which seems to be most of the issues among negative reviews.   The restaurant week menu seemed like a great deal, since you get a handful of tapas as well as an entree and dessert. We each went with the original tapas, which included manchego cheese, bacon-wrapped goat cheese dates, garlic shrimp, and crab-mix stuffed piquillo peppers. All of these were gluten free except for the stuffed pepper, so I got both of those since the dude can't have gluten--it was a fair trade though, I offered him my stuffed date because I can't hang with goat cheese. The stuffed pepper was tasty, but incredibly filling for a tiny lil thang. It didn't taste super crabby, but was yummy nonetheless. The shrimp were good but not revolutionary, and same with the manchego. The dude says that the stuffed dates were incredible.   For our entrees, he went with the manchego-crusted salmon, and I opted for the vegetable paella. His salmon had a nice flavor to it, though I wouldn't necessarily call it "crusted," probably closer to just "melted." But it was good. I was not a fan of my paella, which was a super bummer. The flavor was okay, and I loved all of the veggies in it, but it was very very wet. Like, took home the leftovers and reheated them in the microwave the next day and it was still wet. I was very disappointed, as paella is one of my favorite dishes, and generally Spanish tapas places do a great job with it.   He had the fried plantains for dessert, which were delicious. I had the churros which were good but again, not revolutionary.  We got a pitcher of the red sangria, which was very yummy and absolutely filled to the brim. It seemed like an insane amount of liquid, but I was quite happy about it.   Overall, everything probably averaged out to fine. Would probably recommend sticking with tapas here, and definitely recommend treating yourself to the generous helpings of sangria.

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fried Plantains with Honey
Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Paella De Vegetales
Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gambas al Pil - Pil

vDPAiRMQxVzC-kGqWLNdyA.text: I went to dinner here on my recent trip to visit my brother who just moved to Scottsdale.  We got here pretty early before the Friday evening rush, which ensured great service for the first half of our dinner.  The food was excellent! We ordered a bunch of seafood tapas, pitcher of white sangria which was light and refreshing on a hot summer evening, Valencia paella and finished dinner with a creme brulee.   Our server was very nice and attentive before the rush. When I saw him inside the restaurant I noticed that every server was slammed and running around with sweat dripping off their foreheads.  Having experience in the service industry, it seemed like the restaurant was understaffed, which is something management should try to address since the restaurant is charming and beautiful and the food was great as well!  Will be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Calamari tapas (great calamari)
Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tapas-- probably my favorite tapas!
Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Valencia paella

6jRdVnApxbHjf3EjthOqQg.text: The live dancer and music/dance floor space created a wonderful ambiance. The service was great for our large group.
