sQiiN2QZoVcqEiF1OwKBAw.text: Went here on a recommendation as I had a gathering of a large group (8). We were very excited to find a Tapas place. It has been several days since my visit and I am still shocked in the experience. The service was bad, we had to ask for someone the help us as our server was also the bartender. When it came time to order the server kept pushing to do the chef special, when we tried to only order a couple of those place and expand the server insisted we wanted to all get the same thing. Needless to say we we with ordering on our own. I personally had the beef tenderloin, bacon wrapped dates, and garlic chicken. I am thankful they finally brought us bread as I ended up needing that to fill my stomach. I couldn't finish the 2 pieces of meat as it was not good, 2 others tried to help as another person also ordered and they felt that same way. The chicken was ok but nothing to write home about. 2 people ordered some kind of hot dish, they got their food 20 yes 20 minutes after we all received ours. A few of us were kicking ourselves for not just leaving and going down to Bario Queen.  If this place plans to stay around they need to step up their game, there are WAY too many places to eat in AZ.

pmsD_8mmKg0YI0u_Hc7U1g.text: One of my fave restaurants. They have so many small plates to try and live flamenco dancing on Friday and Saturday nights.

VYE7wUfGZggNkHUVRlOKXw.text: Stopped for dinner here a few weeks back. Food was pretty good, but a bit overpriced for what is offered. Having been to Spain several times, I was searching for some more of the traditional tapas and only a few were on the menu. The paella was OK, but nothing to ride home about.

Zepl-AAAjz-i9o03i077Uw.text: The restaurant itself is located in a picturesque location and has lovely ambiance. There are Miro-like paintings decorating the walls and in the evenings there is live guitar music.   We ordered an array of tapas (Typically around $6-10 per order) and the Paella Valenciana (About $20 per person). I enjoyed the cured meats (Chorizo, jamon Serrano), the potato dish (Tortilla de Patatas), and the garlic chicken (Pollo a la Cazadora). The clam and asparagus tapas we ordered (Txirlas a la Koskera) had a light sauce but there was a considerable amount of grit in some clams that we ate. One had so much grit I could hear the crunch when my friend chewed! The white asparagus was tender but very vinegary in stark contrast to the very light tasting sauce.  The paella was beautifully presented and had some of the flavor of a typical paella, but I wasn't impressed with the actual execution. It was served in a paella pan, but the rice was all the same texture and had a lot of liquid in it. It didn't have any of the socarrat, i.e., the caramelized crispy rice on the bottom that paellas typically have. Since there were clams in it apparently the grit from the clams dispersed itself into the sauce because there were some bites where I felt like I was eating sandy rice. As with the clam tapas dish, quite a few of the clams I chewed on had a substantial amount of sand in it (So much that I had to spit some of them out). The rest of the seafood was unremarkable, as the shrimp was overcooked and tough, and the mussels were mushy tasting.   The best parts of the paella were the small Spanish sausage chunks in it (Txistorra sausage). It had a piquant bold taste that was unique and went great with the rice.  Dessert was one of the highlights of the meal. We shared some churros, apple-banana bread pudding (Pastel de Pan, $6), and a special coconut ice cream in a young coconut shell ($12). The churros had a crispy shell with a molten creamy center, and was served with a dark chocolate dip. The bread pudding was decent, but the caramelized sauce of the pudding masked a lot of the taste of banana or apple. The coconut ice cream was probably my favorite dessert, as it was rich, creamy, and a very sizable portion to share.  Although the ambiance can't be beat, I'm not sure I'd come here again for paella or for any of their seafood. I would possibly come here again for some tapas and/or dessert.

Tz_sTNEeDx3AVKB0MEjv3A.text: New Year's Eve dinner 2017:   First of all I was surprised how empty the restaurant was in comparison to past years on that special night.  Lots of empty tables especially on the patio where we sat.  The ambience is great in this restaurant.  Nice patio and nice decorations.  Service was very friendly but waited for the food longer than usual, which was fine, since we wanted to take our time also on New Years Eve. The most disappointing to me where the small portions and high prices for the small size portions!!!  We had not been to Tapas Papa Fritas for over a year and I was shocked how the portion size had shrunk.  The tapas were a huge disappointment in comparison to what they used to be. Knowing this now I might not be back to this place despite the beautiful location & ambience. Tapas where too expensive for the small portions.

gRvXX1enGhj1KE3z2fTQBg.text: This place is awesome. The place is very nicely decorated, the waiter was polite and friendly and the food was FABULOUS. We had several tapas instead of entrees and EVERYTHING was great. Try the different mushroom tapas. We are definitely coming back here.

gI2cni0o9yCI8UnLGE2iCg.text: Huge portions, delicious food, pretty atmosphere and ambience.  The flamenco dancers were so much fun.

sw5fQxYAPvq1SuMiLT0HUA.text: I like selection and options, and this is somthing you will find here, including many vegetarian (but not vegan) friendly options.   Thew cuzine is a bit new to me, so please forgive me if I forgo the formal dish names. We had a veggie pot pie, with Cauliflower, zuccini and mangego with a great pastry top.  A Garbanzo beand and spinach pesto dish, Veggie paella and more.  Overall I liked the flavors, textures and presentation. The prices of the tappas $7-9 was a bit high considering how many one would need to make a meal. It is also quite loud here with the flamenco music so don't expect too many deep conversations.

VbVpf_uO_zGW_O3HhnuJdA.text: Great service from Danielle.  Great outdoor music with horns, guitar,  and bongos...wanted to dance but others did. I had the black rice and ink pialla and it was one of the best I've ever had. A must stop in Scottsdale.  You will enjoy. Dinner for two with a full bottle of wine for under $100...wow. You gotta try this place

sm2038vGVoFlFwQwJQ2-NQ.text: Lovely atmosphere, professional and attentive waiters, and quality food and drinks. There was live music and dancers which made the restaurant very lively. The tapas were all delicious and unique. The paella was a little watery but very tasty. We were satisfied sharing the chef tasting special ($45 for 6 tapas, paella, and a glass of moscato). I would definitely recommend this place for a nice night out.

s2QOi2qzcZx3RC7cdu1_Gg.text: Love the food location atmosphere flamenco. January in Scottdale eating outside perfect Saturday night with family and friends.

Every bite we had left us wanting more !!! The flavor of the food just melted in your mouth !  We were out on the Patio which was very cozy and fun ! I definitely recommend it for a date !!

cWUFOMPi7DM5H_hLiBe2zA.text: Open late ! Large delicious menu that makes you want to venture out of the norm ! Staff is hands on and takes pride in their work ! Live band on weekends and attentive bartenders ! Need I say more ?  Oh , their bread service !!!!!!!

The live flamenco music they played was pretty cool. The architecture and decor seemed authentic from photos of Spanish cafes I've seen in pictures. The wine list was generous and the food was delicious!!! The service was great too.  A solid 5 stars!!!

_7MTmc4e4BYF2u4hTuYANg.text: Terrible service.  Could not locate our waiter for over 20 minutes.  We ordered a mix of entrees and tapas.  One entree was still not ready 15 minutes after everyone else in the party was finished eating.  Employees were clearing our table already, asking if we wanted the check.  Nobody knew who our waiter was nor could they locate him.  Servers and cooks loudly arguing with each other.  We were dining early and it wasn't even busy yet.  Those of us that were served food enjoyed everything.  Finally asked for the last entree to be packed to go since everyone else had finished eating and we had ordered over 45 minutes prior.  It turns out they had still not fired the entree.   One of our party stayed behind to wait for them to finish it while the others left.

GUShls_B9qbGXbnm5FPRLw.text: High prices, good food, very poor service.  Music and dancing were ok, but staff seemed quite disorganized.  Food runners rudely shoved plates onto the table, went without water for 20 minutes.  Will never come here again.

-JIAEaic2mvPrfcHxsWuiw.text: So the ambience here is great. They tried to theme it like the Mezquita catedral in Cordoba. But that alone is not enough to make up for its short fall. The food is just simply not good. The taste is non existent. Very bland. We ordered the Patatas, the croquetas and meatballs. The meatballs looked like, and tasted like they were bought from the frozen section, and some tomatoe soup was added. On top of that, the portions were not that big. Real tapas in Spain are meant to be shared. 3 croquetas for 8 dollars is insane. So to sum it all up, the ambience was good. They had a flamenco dancer, nice beautiful bar, and great service. The food is the biggest let down. It was bland, heavily overpriced, and under portioned. It is not what tapas are about.

qdgFR1HO43GXuGZTwhBrTg.text: Wonderful atmosphere. Performers and live music is great. The place was packed. Parking was a challenge. The food was good and the party I was with had a great time. Looking forward to going back to try more things on the menu.

mmwoIjoJZXEaTP35aEPXGw.text: Prices expensive. Portions small. Food either overly spicy or blah. Not crazy about the plate by plate delivery to table. When the gals and I want to go out to eat we would like all our food on the table to share not have to nibble then wait 15 minutes then nibble and so on.

r3PiJU-KxPEATSJWBHSa3Q.text: By far the best and most authentic Spanish food I've had! Great service, beautiful location and decor and cool atmosphere especially with the live performance! I went on a Friday night and sat at the bar with my bf and received the friendliest service by a a young blonde bartender great experience, and will recommend to others!

wPOTOkSq02mk0JJML05e9g.text: My boyfriend and I went for dinner because he'd been wanting to try it for some time. We did the chef's tasting menu and it was amazing. We had 6 little tapas and split a paella. Everything was delicious. The only critique was the socarrat for the paella wasn't as crunchy as I'd expected. Service was great as well.

RMnyDVQfFUBM6zQsHWd6zg.text: Horse hockey will a capital H.  Made a reservation for 12 people at 6:45 last night and didn't leave the restaurant until 10:00.  We came here to celebrate our birthdays and left p*ssed off and annoyed.  Absolute cr*p service throughout the dinner.  I had people bumping into my chair as well, which made the night even worst.  Waiters were arguing all night, dishes were being thrown around, must of heard at least 5 times where dishes were being cracked and smashed.  Here's a sample how the night was.  Waiter was no where to be seen, took us half an hour just to get the menu's.  Finally a female, (might of been the manager) comes over and apologizes over and over, finally our waiter came over. She asked him, have you read the specials yet?  He replied No, and she told him to go ahead and name the specials, it was clear, he was agitated and when she left, he didn't even read them off!  Very awkward, I looked at my wife and just gasped...Holy sh*t we are going to be in for a while ride.  I don't blame our waiter, he looked flustered and overwhelmed all night.  Actually everybody did, the service was so bad that they kept on apologizing and offered a bottle of champagne for their incompetence.  Regardless, when the 1st course would come out, half of the party never got what they requested and some didn't even get their food.  When entree's came out, my wife and I didn't even get ours and by the time we did, our party had already finished their meals.  Complete chaos.  I looked in the kitchen and looked like they had two dudes working.  My wife and I come from families that own restaurants, and we completely felt sorry for the wait staff and how poorly they are at their jobs.  At least hire people that "pretend" to care, you're better off getting better customer service at Walmart.  Our bill came out to 585.00 and half of us were still hungry and talked about hitting up In and Out afterwards.    I'm not even going to talk about the food, not worth my time.  As I walked out of the restaurant, I ended up throwing the leftovers away in the trash.  I want to completely erase this place from my memory.  I will not go to this place ever again.  NEXT!

QfsYkswgmKbA8j7mZQGkMg.text: The food was amazing!!! Get the chef special!! The decor of the restaurant is warm and the staff was wonderful!! Esteban was a great server!!

n0jjO858_2LU36eEZY8yZQ.text: Definitely try the chefs tasting! It was an easy way to try a little bit of everything! Service was good for us, but we were there very early. They had the band playing outside and we were sitting outside so we didn't get to hear the band.

F-vsygnEJn779ciZGDfxJg.text: Got a beautiful place outside as requested. Tried the chef special and it did not disappoint. Overall, though the price was  a little on the higher side. worth it for special occasions.

G76CS_Km54MlLEcTTW_1qQ.text: I want to start by saying the food is excellent, especially the paella and the stuffed dates!   However, my review is about the owner Chef Joseph whom we met for the first time last night during restaurant week. The restaurant was packed and he was so busy.  I had my special needs brother with me and he came out immediately to make sure he was comfortable and able to see the flamingo dancer from his seat. But even more above and beyond, we had not ordered him a meal, he was just going to eat a little off our plates but chef Joseph brought out chicken fingers and French fries for him. Please keep in mind,restaurant week and packed and we did not order! Tapas Papas, you have made a life long fan and friend in us! Thank you for the wonderful food and kindness.

CHECv92mO6TZ1-qyFW7fFA.text: Don't waste your Saturday night. There were no flamenco dancers at 7:30 as advertised. Which is the only reason we chose to go there that night. Poor service, waiter vanished and never put all our orders in. Nor did he check on us but once the entire evening. Terrible owner. Went there for my girlfriends birthday. Must have told them 15 times it was her special "50" and instead of being treated like the awesome person that she is,  the ugly owner and his nose ended up yelling at HER!( for no reason in my honest opinion)!  Telling her that she is "hard to please". Simply because she asked him why there were no flamenco dancers there at 7:30 when that is what is advertised by the establishment. Unbelievable. Oh ya the bathrooms were out of soap and there was vomit all over the floor. So if your looking to ruin the romance.. Head on down there!

Aa0FfcpgaT8deBc58r7WZA.text: Went here for a bday party.  All of the food was amazing!  We had six different Tapas and a huge pan of Paella and loved every bite!  They also had music and a flamenco dancing to add to the fun!

iQuSukRfrLY64_xde0G7vw.text: Delicious authentic tapas, incredible sangria, and mouth watering paella. The patio area is very intimate with a great ambiance, even if seated next to super obnoxious drunk tourists who pronounce tapas as "taay-puhs".  This has been our go to for special occasions such as an anniversary or New Year's Eve. But it's also a great pick me up for a weekday when a craving for sangria strikes. Either way we get great service every time. It's definitely an experience, one that continues to surprise with something exciting or undiscovered every visit. Even the bread and garlic aioli is incredible. Gambas al ajillo is another favorite. I have a garlic addiction, what can I say?  As an AZ native, the thought of fancying up a canal and calling it the "waterfront" is hilarious. But the patio does have a really relaxing vibe next to the water and you can forget for a moment that a canal isn't terribly exciting.

rNKnHhysNbA2csnutBEymg.text: The Owner Joseph, is hospitable. His daughter the hostess is a sweetheart! Flamenco night is when we were there. Talk about passion! Whew!!!!! Food is outstanding! As good as In Madrid or Barcelona! Wine List is fabulous as well! Great ambiance!

K4yCk7AnYASNa6sdzxx28w.text: Excellent food, service and live music. I went their a while back and always recommend this place. It was a bit pricy but worth it.

zpsMMJfAO9ZC-8hT_LjzFQ.text: Great selection of tapas including ox tails which is a rarity to find in this neck of the woods! Servers are great, flamenco music and dance happens regularly and we found this to be a great night out.  Typically we steer away from scottsdale eateries over the weekend but this was a great night out, not overly packed, and the filet tapas were amazing.  Olives, not so much, and mushrooms were lame but everything else was fabulous

gWbwX7DMdqjlE4DBuAPTjA.text: This is one of our favorite restaurants and we frequent it once a month for birthday celebrations. The tapas are fabulous, ambiance romantic, and the service is quality. For a superb server request Eduardo or Zino; both are focussed on service and detail.

B8pWzeBo-J0CvRn57017OQ.text: Amazing food, and fun atmosphere. I'm surprised at this restaurant's low reviews. I've never had a bad dish here!! The food is fantastic and full of flavor! Everything is pretty spectacular. The tapas are excellent, paella is delicious, the escargot are the best I've had. They've got a great happy hour, and the pricing on the regular menu is decent considering that it's in Old Town. Whenever my mom comes to visit, all she wants is to go to this restaurant!!

35_pZSKcjC8mkQMwHnwUpA.text: The website for Tapas Papa Frita shows that they have happy hours between 3-6 p.m. and that some tapa appetizers are 50 percent, drinks are 2 for the price of 1. We went there expecting that but the waiter informed us that they don't have happy hour. Even though we were disappointed we still stayed and ordered a variety of tapas. The tapas were okay but we felt that the website was misleading and that they practice False advertising.

vdxyaQxn2K0RDiTYSLBmkQ.text: Saturday night at the bar. We had five tapas and all yummy. 2 Cod, grilled squid, some eggplant in tomato sauce thing, and a pot pie stuffed with zucchini and cauliflower. Bottle of wine, $85. Really a good time, great bartender. Couldn't see the flamenco, but the crowd loved it. I was a bit preoccupied with March Madness.

E5hqWVNsF4NbVAKdKvPvag.text: So overpriced for what?  Not sure.  Food wasn't that good.  Service was eh. Again, so overpriced for what?

xbqgJil4NYzwUXkAMRoowA.text: Beyond fun with amazing food!  A great way to start my birthday weekend!  Giovanni, Aaron and Sean were so attentive and charming.  We will go back again and again!

QyJSEfI7LJZDgf6OoR9GVA.text: I always wanted to try this restaurant, so when it was available for restaurant week, we gave it a try.  I strongly have to agree with other recent reviewers that the service and management of this place needs a serious overhaul.    Our service was very impersonal.  The hostess was indifferent when we arrived - barely acknowledging us when we walked into the door and struggling to even smile.  We came well before classic Scottsdale rush hour and the restaurant was not even 50% full.    Our service was so slow.  Our waitress had very few tables and barely paid attention to us sometimes disappearing for 30-45 minutes at a time.  As an example, it took us 30 minutes for us to get our desert after they cleared our dinner plates.  She never offered coffee or after dinner drinks.  Our waitress disappeared during the whole time.    We had to ask a bus boy for help.    Our food was average at best including very bland rice dishes and to have that at a Spanish restaurant!?! Come on.  Save your money and try somewhere else nearby.  This area definitely has better restaurants to offer.

1HXHeRMygdsBHghDFaGOzQ.text: It's been a long time since I've eaten tapas, because I generally like big portions, but I was a guest so I figured, "what the heck." The atmosphere was buzzing.  It was crowded but my cousin had the forethought to make reservations, so they sat our party right away. This was the most interesting place I have been to in a long time. They had a menu with tapas and meals. Tapas are like tasting-size portions. Now, they also had a chef's special menu. The special was 5 or 6 different tapas, then a meal, and a digestive (I haven't drank alcohol in 10 years, but it smelled like port.. Of course I looked at the price for the special and it was $45 per person.  I thought. "Is it New Year's Eve and I've become senile?" But every special was enough for two people, so it wasn't New Year's Eve. My cousins had shared vegetarian tapas, and I split a regular one with the only other non-kosher family member. My tapas were a small lamb chop, shrimp scampi, a fig wrapped in bacon, a skewer of beef, some cherry tomatoes, and a pepper stuffed with goat cheese. Everything was good. The meal was paella served on a skillet. The portion was larger than I expected, and the authenticity was there. But the thing that really stood out, was the service. Our waiter was in the top five waiters that I've had in my life. He could teach a class on how to be a waiter. Helpful without being obtrusive, smiling, good energy level, happy to explain everything, the works. He also gave us six free ports, which was very generous. I can honestly say that it was worth the price, and I don't say that too often when it's more that $30 per person. When I visit Scottsdale again, I'm sure that we'll go there.

gaLESc9keLO6nfvy_O792w.text: Overpriced American food in Spanish dress with an occasional up sell. I found this place to be mediocre at best (speaking of the food, lackluster service aside). Maybe if we got entertainment it would be worth the price. The aceitunas seem like like grocery store olives ($7) with some herbs on them (the same sauce they put on a bunch of other dishes). Patatas bravas are wedge fries with sauce on them. Having been in Spain, absolutely nothing here tastes authentic. Even the manchego felt like they may have picked it up at trader joes was overpriced and came with an up-sell to a bigger cheese plate.

EfkfwpgeZZjlJ9L25JttRA.text: The food was so delicious! I didn't really know what a lot of it was but I enjoyed every bite. If you don't eat tapas a lot I'd Google some of this in advance so you know what to expect but it was all really good. We got four small plates which was awesome for two people. Very filling but not too much food. It was all kind of rich as well so don't go in expecting many low calorie options. The service was great and the flamenco was really cool for the atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. One of our tapas. This is the very last item on the &#34;veggie&#34; section.
Photo of Tapas Papa Frita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Flamenco!

ovGi2j_sk3J6-SmV8VQkGg.text: Paella is amazing here! We went on a Saturday night, there was music and flamenco dancers. Had the best time. Great spot for a romantic dinner or a dinner with great friends. Service was great. I will definitely be going back!

l5oMb_q6UP7fxnWQ7BVYqg.text: Great patio , great vibe get there for live music night! All apptz great ! Great deal on apptz definitly will go again ! Service lacked but other than that nice vibe at night .

7FfMsSvI5G9nx2msG2wGGw.text: The manager was rude to my wife. He accused us of not having a reservation for more than 24 hours? When he went to look at our reservation he noticed we placed it two weeks ago. HE SHOULD NOT ASSUME AND TREAT CUSTOMERS LIKE THAT ESPECIALLY MY WIFE. When we sat down with our party of six, from Atlanta, Jorge our waiter for rude too. We got half of our food 2.5 hours later and our guests from Atlanta were never given their plates. This place is very racist. Our waiter Jorge refilled everyone's drink accept our friends from Atlanta....? This is place is so wrong.

FjcSXOok8BP5uEW13W9TIg.text: Pitcher of sangria $36!? Extremely hard to understand the waiter while he explains the specials. Also, his recommendations were way off! $50 per person or the prix fix -paella and tapas. No thanks, I'll pay $20 for paella for the table and get individual tapas for each person. "Well the $20 paella usually serves just 1" he said. Well I'll be the judge of that. I order it, it comes, a huge skillet with rice, 5 shrimp, 6 mussels, 6 clams, chicken and sausage. ALL 4 of us couldn't finish it. Not an enriching experience. In my opinion.

_Gw9ON0E2xngWZTSaAMjNA.text: This restaurant has a Beautiful outdoor seating area! I ordered 3 tapas, Pollo Rebozado, patatas bravas, and the shrimp.    I was amazed at how delicious everything was. I thought the portions would be quite small but they are large enough to fill you up. Also, they bring you bread with this yummy white sauce. I ended up using that sauce on all the tapas as well.

JkCDGaJjC_i9q1BUrMPiIA.text: The food was excellent. Joseph was very helpful in helping us with the Menu and making recommendations. It was a thoroughly enjoyable evening. I would most certainly go back to the restaurant next time I am in Scottsdale.

R_KsmSPQNnRAO-IaFra3iA.text: Came here for a birthday, food was good. Service could have been a little better! Our server looked a little like he was being tortured the whole time. Being in the industry as well, I know that a little personality goes a long way with your meal and often makes up for any shortcomings with the service. I'd go again and ask for Raul next time!

kwkNAbDtN6Bb5dbJd5omtw.text: Just order a bunch of stuff and don't look back. As others have already said the waitstaff can be aloof at times. If the music isn't deafening next time I go I'll give them a fifth star.

z4GKSmyCvUVmkJOoiqtoPg.text: Very disappointing overall, which is a shame because the food was good. But the wait service was way below subpar. Between waiting 10 minutes to be seated and another 20 just to get our food order in, will not return here. We wound up having to go to the bar to get our drink order. And the amazing part was the place wasn't even packed. The restaurant was half empty. It was clear they were severely understaffed. In this day and age of instant reviews, first impressions are critically important. This place failed to have even basic customer service in place and does not warrant a return visit, especially given the higher end prices they charge.

HvZKZ0XC0eOXCAF1PnLZVQ.text: Although having vaguely heard of Tapas Papa Fritas, and a connoisseur of excellent Spanish Cuisine - I didn't pay much attention to this eatery, I am very astonished to say, because of its name - Fried Potato Snacks!  Boy was I wrong!  Being of Spanish heritage, I was flabbergasted with Tapas Papa Fritas' traditional atmosphere, an atmosphere emitting Basque, Andalusian, Moorish, Castilian and Asturian regions feel, decor and food!  This appealing and large eatery smacks of being in Spain!  From being almost obscure in its external surroundings, once you step up the path to the front door, past the traditional-style plant-filled veranda, see their fabulous outdoor seating area, you have arrived to the old world of Espana!  Having grown up in a Spanish-Cuban atmosphere, I am well versed in the fare offerings, what I should anticipate both traditionally and in any nouveau prospects.  I was impressed and satisfied!  While absorbing the atmosphere, we were seated near a window whereby we had the opportunity to admire both the inside and outside, as we experienced a fine bottle of Pinetti Notte Pinot Grigio Delle Venezie 2014.  My wife and I were pleased to see some of the old-world as well as fine-dining traditions followed by our Server, Sina who showed his expertise in not only fine proper serving, but old-world rapport, pleasantry and knowledge.  Elegant service from table cloths, silverware and the use of an enoteca for wine.  As newcomers to the establishment, we decided to try something that would give us the widest array of samplings, so we started with their Tapas Deluxe Special which included: Gambas al Pil-Pil, Chorizo, Txistorra, Stuffed Dates, Queso Manchego, Chicken Skewer, and a Lamb Shank - all prepared and served to perfection.  And, just as is in the Old World, no rush... patience, enjoyment and privacy abound.  We then went for the main course.  My wife thoroughly enjoyed (I did too) her serving of Paella Valenciana in a traditional style with saffron rice, fresh clams, mussels, shrimp, tender chicken, extraordinary txistorra, peppers, onions, tomatoes and peas - beyond delectable it was!  I proceeded to have their incredible rendition of Conejo (Rabbit) Romescu Catalan-style, with a soft to the palate peppery tomato almond sauce over an excellent rendition of traditional saffron rice.  If you enjoy rabbit as I do, this dish is for you - amazing!  I believe it needless to say, by the end of our meal, we had no room for dessert of which they have a wonderful assortment of Spanish selections.  It is no wonder why this eatery has received the accolades it has on media, from critics and awards alike -the food, the atmosphere, the staff, the accoutrements and the vibe are magnificent.  Our profound kudos to Chef Joseph Gutierrez and his incredible art.  As unfortunately so many 'Traditional' Spanish in the Valley and across the country tend to do, sway to changing the great things which don't need changing from our past - the only nouveau here is the first time patron.  We look forward to visiting them as frequently as possible to get our taste buds wrapped around more of their fabulously authentic cuisine, Flamenco shows and live Latin music during the weekends.  Can't wait for the next visit.  Excellent ambience, service, hospitality and food - next time I'm going for my favorite: Zarzuela (Seafood Stew - some may know it as Spanish-style Bouillabaisse)!  Bon appetit!

U5qZQqqw_jlXzJOcmsgN9w.text: The bussers are better than the server and that says a lot considering there are only four tables seated in this joint. I am giving a two star because the sangria is awesome and only $2, however, the service is lacking. I'm fairly positive that my server is high. Plus who wears a limp Mohawk to work!!

mzllU5gQHvrZN80y-ri3vw.text: This restaurant is hiding on the 2nd floor, closer to the canal than Stetson Street. My GPS got fooled. Fortunately, my friends were smarter & left me some breadcrumbs to find them there.  Speaking of bread, it's ok but the garlic aioli sauce is more than ok. Do ask for it. It goes well with...the bread ;)  I got the entree, sole dipped in egg. Amen. That's all I can say. Always nervous ordering seafood in Arizona. This was great. Very fresh.  My friends did the tapas thing. I tried their croquettes de Jamon. They were good but we didn't find any Jamon in there.  The waiter was from Spain. What a refreshing change of pace. I speak a little Spanish & had a blast trying to converse.  There was a bit of live flamenco, but my eye was more distracted by the flat screen showing the NBA Finals :D  Bring some friends, try a bunch of stuff. I think you'll enjoy it.

brh25ecwpx4nQaCik3fdPQ.text: Let me start by saying how much I love the food here, it's amazing. That being said i was sorely disappointed tonight when I showed up for my 7 year anniversary. We walked in to be told that they were closed for a private party but we could dine outside if we wanted to. We obliged just to be told by someone else that they were indeed closed to the public and were not allowed to dine anywhere, including their very empty patio. Needless to say we were very disappointed and I definitely feel discouraged about returning. Nothing worse than getting roundabout answers from staff just to be turned away.

ZFsE8b8WuX5Dt1WfDhCYjA.text: I had a group dinner last night. We were seated outside near the fire pit. We all ordered the chef menu which included 6 or 8 taps items all outstanding but the lamb chops, they were too well done. The paella was absolutely outstanding!    In addition to the Chef menu we ordered 2 of the special prosciutto dishes one a standard and the second from a walnut fed pig. I'm not a big prosciutto fan but these were outstanding! The walnut fed was exceptionally pricy at 30.00 for the app! Be forewarned this was a bit of a surprise to me.   The service was excellent! The waiter was fun engaged and did a very good job. The bus staff did not speak much English.   Nice wine list, bone up on Spanish wines as they make up a large portion of the wine list.   Bottom line we will go back! And I'd order the lamb again the flavor was great just med well grilled.

UsZfS4QK4x0PtvsBsIzL1g.text: After deciding we wouldn't enjoy having a thumping bass beat accompany our weekend dinner at nearby Olive & Ivy, we escaped to the much quieter Tapas Papa Frita.  The hostess, Nanette, found us a quiet outdoor table on zero notice despite what eventually became a busy night at this restaurant at Fashion Square Mall.  Service was enthusiastic and professional, food was very good and we even got to catch a bit of the wonderful mariachi dancing.  Top food options we tried were the chicken paella, the calamari and the dates.  If you actually want to be able to have a conversation with your dining companions while enjoying a very good meal, this is a place you should strongly consider.

16gRl9GDci6x3Tdnvlx1Ug.text: First off, they have a beautiful outside patio area where you can people watch. It was a perfect 82 degrees when I went there. Me and a friend had a pitcher of the red sangria, which was delicious and refreshing. We also had quite a lot of tapas including: crab and eggplant tart, marinated olives, queso manchego, Jamon serrano, ceviche, and jamon and cheese croquttes. Topped it off with a flan dessert with an orange cream liquer and I had the chocolate cake with condensed milk with a glass of red port. It was a delightful atmosphere and meal. Have been there many times!!

UtJCjkh5jHl3Frk_Zacyjg.text: The place is nice for a romantic dinning...but the food and prices are not that worth to go there again. Everything is over priced and the amount of food is like baby bite. I ordered 7 tapas for 2 people ($80 not includes drinks)...we are only 70% full...but lucky that we asked for addition order of "free breads". Use the bread dipped in the left over sauce on the plate, then we call it done for the day.  Stuffed squid: thumb size -room temperature - one piece - nothing taste specail Crab Stuffed in peper: thumb size - two piece - room temperature- real crab meat but can't taste the fresh, and texture like mesh potato in pepper... Escargots: a nickle size - about 8 pieces - it is hot - taste olive oil and garlic - it is alright - something can't eat everywhere Lamb rack: 2 pieces, cooked medium well, tender, 3/16" thick, 1"x2" of meat, warm, - worth to order it Ox tail: one medium size of ox tail (as big as 1 yrs old baby's hand), $8?? I believe it is pre-cooked, the outside is warm, the inside is less then room temperature, I really want to ask the waiter to take the ox tail, put in back to the microware to re-heat for another minutes..but the food just too small...just eat and swallow...(don't try to complain, the waiter always not around). Potatos: $7 for 14 pieces of fries...totally not worth it.... Paella: One of the main reason to go to this restaurant, this is hot, and the taste is not disappointed. About 1.5 bowls of rice with all kinds of seafood....but i don't like that shrimps....not fresh... for 14 pieces of fries...totally not worth it.... Paella: One of the main reason to go to this restaurant, this is hot, and the taste is not disappointed. About 1.5 bowls of rice with all kinds of seafood....but i don't like that shrimps....not fresh...

paSuIVSU5MO_0NrblTXzAQ.text: What a splendid find!!! The host, Enrique, delightful, charming and made us feel most welcome. The tapas were delish. Service by Patrick was excellant with good desriptions of the menu.  The music was also a huge addition to an already pleasant atmosphere.  Highly recommended.

HvPnz_vYQ771dw7wVhfGXQ.text: This is our new favorite place in Scottsdale!  The food was phenomenal, the service was great and the ambience was charming with great live music.    Nick took wonderful care of us from the moment I called to make the reservation.  He personally chose a selection of tapas and paella for our group of 6 based on the things we told him we liked and not a single dish disappointed!  Favorites include the lamb chops, the filet skewers, cheese-stuffed portobellos and bacon/cheese empenadas.  The seafood paella was also incredible!  I also highly recommend the sangria, both the traditional and the white.  Nick comped all the birthday boy's drinks which was a very thoughtful gesture and was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and wine selection.  We were there for dinner, but we will definitely be back again soon for happy hour... 3-6pm every day and the entire menu and sangria are 50% off!  In a town where new, overly-hyped restaurants come and go on the regular, we were very pleasantly surprised with Tapas Papa Frita and can't wait to go back.

VwmEmZN0MOf94QRAy3ywxw.text: Was in town for a medical conference and saw this place. Good location on the 'canal'.   Do not order the "special".  They cooked everything at once. Unfortunately the quality of food went down as the meal progressed.  The first tapa was good, properly cooked and well seasoned. The second was lamb and tenderloin. Both overcooked. The third , Paella. I even went so far as to tell the server that we were not in a hurry and to not send out the paella as we wanted to enjoy the wine. They brought out the food as soon as I asked them to begin making it.  It was most likely sitting around for a while. Unfortunately when it arrived it was not hot and over cooked.  Probably better to order things individually...make them cook it at the appropriate time.  Would have given it 1 star but.....

DF0Dxi0OW4ISSxkL5ZeX5A.text: Wow, where to begin. I have been here three times now (twice for dinner and once for dessert and coffee) and I can say with certainty that this is the best Tapas restaurant in America (that I've been to, anyways). I live in Chicago and have been to countless mediocre tapas joints here, in Miami, throughout the Midwest, NYC, but nothing compares to Papas Fritas. First, the restaurant. Gorgeous, lit like a Sofia Coppola film at sunset. Most beautiful patio I've ever dined on. The service, always been good even one night that was crazy busy they kept our plates coming. Food: wonderful with a belt-busting selection of plates. They even do live Flamenco!!! I have had some horrendous experiences in Scottsdale and elsewhere in the valley (I'm looking at you Cold Beer & Cheeseburgers) especially so I don't want to be one of those jerks that only reviews things when I want to complain. Anyways I can't wait to come back to Scottsdale for some warmth for the winter and some tapas.

MCWyNLmItnKriuKVz_Cxiw.text: The food here is very good.  All of the tapas appear to be good.  Got several and enjoyed them with my wife, and father.  I was at this place last night.  I still miss Iruna's, as it is closed for remodeling.  I would have gone to Iruna's if they were open.    My wife said that the food at Tapas Papa Frita was good, but like me, she wishes Iruna's would hurry up and complete their remodeling, as she likes the food better there.

cEnUb_6TuECSVNJEor5lig.text: I used to work literally across the street, and still only came here maybe once or twice a year for happy hour. What they consider happy hour prices is much more expensive what I consider happy hour prices. However, the food is good, and the service is good. They even have a doggy area for people like me who like to take their dog with them. It is very expensive, but it is a nice treat.
